Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




Build the Future of Data – Join our Team!




Our Data Cloud is transforming how businesses discover, integrate, and leverage data products. Through our Marketplace, organizations can seamlessly access valuable datasets, applications, and AI models.




At the heart of this ecosystem is Secure Data Sharing, enabling providers and consumers to publish, discover, and monetize data and services. Instead of relying on traditional delivery methods like files and APIs, providers leverage Data Sharing to distribute their data efficiently. Marketplace and Data Sharing are central to our vision, fueling the network effect of our Data Cloud.




As a temporary worker on the Collaboration & Marketplace team, you will play a key role in shaping our internal content arm—curating public data into scalable, high-quality products that enhance our customers’ analytics capabilities. Public datasets—spanning finance, economics, government, and weather—are critical for businesses across industries.

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible to monitor the public data pipelines daily and help address/fix errors promptly, allowing customers to rely on this data for their business operations.




Responsibilities:

Monitor data pipelines for failures (formatting, source, duplicative data, etc).
Investigate errors by analyzing logs, GitHub repositories, provider websites, and SQL queries to pinpoint issues.
Engage with public data providers when issues arise on their end, ensuring swift resolution.
Proactively improve data pipelines to improve data integrity and reduce errors.
Maintain strict SLAs (e.g., 4-hour response time) and aim for 0% error rate at the end of each day.
Collaborate with the Data Engineering team in daily scrum meetings.
Identify and implement process improvements to enhance efficiency and reliability.




Requirements:

Education & Experience:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
5+ years of experience in Data Analysis, Software Engineering, Data Engineering, or Data Quality Operations.

Technical / Analytical Skills:

Advanced SQL proficiency (joins, subqueries, constraints, daily use).
Experience creating, maintaining and troubleshooting data pipelines written in Python and SQL, leveraging GitHub, dbt, Spark or equivalent tools.
Familiarity with Cloud and SaaS environments is a plus.

Communication & Problem-Solving:

Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Experience working directly with customers to resolve data issues.
Proactive problem solver who takes initiative, identifies solutions, and navigates fast-paced environments effectively.

Additional Preferences:

Proven track record of meeting SLAs and quality targets.
Experience or familiarity with the financial services industry or related domains is a plus




Compensation:

Up to $79.31/hr. (W2)
Show more
HTML:
Data Analyst


Build the Future of Data – Join our Team!


Our Data Cloud is transforming how businesses discover, integrate, and leverage data products. Through our Marketplace, organizations can seamlessly access valuable datasets, applications, and AI models.


At the heart of this ecosystem is Secure Data Sharing, enabling providers and consumers to publish, discover, and monetize data and services. Instead of relying on traditional delivery methods like files and APIs, providers leverage Data Sharing to distribute their data efficiently. Marketplace and Data Sharing are central to our vision, fueling the network effect of our Data Cloud.


As a temporary worker on the Collaboration & Marketplace team, you will play a key role in shaping our internal content arm—curating public data into scalable, high-quality products that enhance our customers’ analytics capabilities. Public datasets—spanning finance, economics, government, and weather—are critical for businesses across industries.

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible to monitor the public data pipelines daily and help address/fix errors promptly, allowing customers to rely on this data for their business operations.


Responsibilities:

  • Monitor data pipelines for failures (formatting, source, duplicative data, etc).
  • Investigate errors by analyzing logs, GitHub repositories, provider websites, and SQL queries to pinpoint issues.
  • Engage with public data providers when issues arise on their end, ensuring swift resolution.
  • Proactively improve data pipelines to improve data integrity and reduce errors.
  • Maintain strict SLAs (e.g., 4-hour response time) and aim for 0% error rate at the end of each day.
  • Collaborate with the Data Engineering team in daily scrum meetings.
  • Identify and implement process improvements to enhance efficiency and reliability.


Requirements:

Education & Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5+ years of experience in Data Analysis, Software Engineering, Data Engineering, or Data Quality Operations.

Technical / Analytical Skills:

  • Advanced SQL proficiency (joins, subqueries, constraints, daily use).
  • Experience creating, maintaining and troubleshooting data pipelines written in Python and SQL, leveraging GitHub, dbt, Spark or equivalent tools.
  • Familiarity with Cloud and SaaS environments is a plus.

Communication & Problem-Solving:

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Experience working directly with customers to resolve data issues.
  • Proactive problem solver who takes initiative, identifies solutions, and navigates fast-paced environments effectively.

Additional Preferences:

  • Proven track record of meeting SLAs and quality targets.
  • Experience or familiarity with the financial services industry or related domains is a plus


Compensation:

  • Up to $79.31/hr. (W2)

Title: Data Analytics & Insights Intern
Description:
Description

DATA ANALYTICS & INSIGHTS INTERN

About

Common Sense is a nonprofit organization that gives kids, families, and schools the tools to make informed choices about media and technology. Families know us for our independent, age-based reviews of movies, TV shows, books, games, podcasts, and apps. Educators use our free curriculum and edtech reviews to plan lessons and integrate technology into their teaching practice. At our core, we are a children's advocacy group. We draw on original research, industry expertise, and community partnerships to advocate for laws and policies that help kids thrive.

We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunities to thrive. We hire and cultivate diverse teams of the best and brightest from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We offer a hybrid work model that combines in-office work and remote work opportunities, balancing operational effectiveness and collaboration.

SCOPE

The Data Analytics & Insights Intern will analyze data and generate insights to support decision-making across product and key stakeholder groups such as marketing and business development. This internship is ideal for someone who enjoys working with data, uncovering trends, and translating numbers into meaningful stories.

Responsibilities


Data Collection & Preparation
Gather and clean data from multiple sources, ensuring accuracy and consistency.
Use SQL to query and transform large datasets for analysis.
Organize and document data sources to improve accessibility and reproducibility.
Data Analysis & Insights Generation
Analyze user data across multiple platforms to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement.
Support cross-functional teams with data-driven decision-making.
Conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA) to uncover hidden patterns and correlations.
Reporting & Visualization
Develop dashboards and reports using Tableau, Looker, or Google Data Studio.
Present insights through clear and compelling data visualizations.
Automate reporting processes to streamline access to key metrics.
Experimentation & Performance Measurement
Assist in A/B testing efforts and other experimentation methods.
Measure the impact of product changes and optimizations using statistical analysis.
Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs).


QUALIFICATIONS


SQL proficiency (querying, filtering, aggregating, and joining data).
Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, etc.).
Strong analytical thinking and ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Python for data manipulation (a plus, but not required).
Understanding of A/B testing principles and basic statistical analysis.
Ability to work collaboratively with technical and non-technical teams.
Curiosity, attention to detail, and a passion for working with data.


Additional Information


REPORTS TO: Senior Director, Data & Technology
LOCATION: San Francisco, CA
DURATION: June 16 - August 22, 2025
PAY : $25/hr, up to 40 hours/week This is a paid opportunity, and we will work with your clinical or internship office for school credit if necessary.
Interns must be available to attend weekly educational Lunch & Learns, which are held every Wednesday from 12 p.m. to 1 p.m. (PST).


Common Sense provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy, age, national origin, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, genetic information, or any other protected classification or characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

Common Sense will also consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. However, job offers are made on the condition that the applicant subsequently passes a criminal background check. If the background check indicates a prior criminal conviction, we will conduct an individualized assessment to determine whether the conviction should result in denial of employment. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider employment for qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Req134813

Position Purpose

A Data Analyst Supply Chain leverages technical abilities to synthesize complex analytical tasks into easily understood data-driven stories. Responsible for working collaboratively with other analysts to apply established analytical processes on diverse datasets to deduce insights and solve real-world business problems. Also ensures that all reporting and analytical responsibilities are completed competently in a timely manner, continually seeking out opportunities to hone existing technical skills (e.g. writing SQL/code, statistics, machine learning, etc.) and learn new skills. Operates under the supervision and mentorship of more experienced managers and data scientists.

Key Responsibilities


30% Executes existing reporting and analytical responsibilities
20% Leverages data analytics tools to create new dashboards, reports, and any additional ad-hoc requests
20% Ensures the quality of work output by displaying a keen attention to detail
20% Develops additional technical competencies and subject matter expertise within core functional group
10% Presents findings in easily understood ways, focuses on how the data analytics fits into the bigger picture


Direct Manager/Direct Reports


This postion reports to Manager
This position has no Direct Reports


Travel Requirements


Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time.


Physical Requirements


Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles.


Working Conditions


Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable.


Minimum Qualifications


Must be eighteen years of age or older.
Must be legally permitted to work in the United States.


Preferred Qualifications


Work experience with SQL Server, Teradata, Oracle, or comparable database systems
1-3 years work experience in data mining, statistical analysis, auditing, and/or forecasting.
Prior direct experience in analyzing the relevant subject matter (e.g. Supply Chain, Merchandising, Operations, etc.)
B.S. in Computer Science, Math, Engineering, Finance or related quantitative field


Minimum Education


The knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a bachelor's degree program or equivalent degree in a field of study related to the job.


Preferred Education


No additional education


Minimum Years Of Work Experience


0


Preferred Years Of Work Experience


No additional years of experience


Minimum Leadership Experience


None


Preferred Leadership Experience


None


Certifications


None


Competencies


Critical thinking skills to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions; ability to understand and foresee implications of new information for current and future problems solving.
An unquenchable intellectual curiosity for getting at the underlying story being told within the data.
Strong written and verbal communications skills. Ability to persuade, inform, and influence others based on findings. A track record of taking complex results and communicating them in an easily understood way.
Superior interpersonal skills and ability to collaborate actively and work in a team environment.
Ability to quickly learn and adapt to new technologies, tools, and techniques.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Summary:

Our client is seeking a Data Analyst to join their team! This position is fully remote.




Duties:

Manage mass loads into multiple HR systems using EIBs Enterprise Interface Builders and data loader tools to ensure accurate data transfer and integrity
Conduct thorough 11 validations of data identifying discrepancies and ensuring data accuracy across various datasets
Perform data quality validations confirming that all employees are accounted for in the employee planning system and addressing any discrepancies identified
Ensure that all validation processes and data handling practices comply with Sarbanes-Oxley SOX regulations maintaining documentation and audit trails as required
Utilize Tableau prep and excel for data manipulation analysis and validation processes Write scripts to automate routine validation tasks and improve efficiency
Work with cross-functional teams to understand data flows and ensure comprehensive data processes
Document validation processes findings and methodologies to ensure transparency and facilitate knowledge sharing within the team
Proactively identify opportunities to enhance validation processes and contribute to the development of best practices in data quality assurance




Desired Skills/Experience:

Experience with Workday and EIBs
Experience with data visualization tools particularly Tableau Prep Builder and advanced Excel skills including formulas pivot tables and data analysis functions
Strong analytical skills with a keen eye for detail and a passion for data accuracy
Excellent problem-solving abilities and the capability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment
Strong communication skills with the ability to convey complex data findings to non-technical stakeholders




Benefits:

Medical, Dental, & Vision Insurance Plans
401K offered




$16.06 - $22.95 (est. hourly)

Title: Derivatives Data Analyst
Description:
Required Skills

Traded Products/Capital Markets experience (repo, reverse repo, stock loan/stock borrow, collateral, securities, derivatives)
Bachelor's degree
3+ years of experience in the Financial Services industry (at BAC or a similarly-sized institution) researching and remediating data issues impacting financial, risk, or regulatory reporting functions, project management or other data management & data control environment;
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft software (Excel, Word, Power Point) including advanced excel functions such as pivot tables, Vlookup and Microsoft Visual Basic (VBA) to supplement SQL skills in data analysis exercises.
A balance of strong analytical & problem-solving skills and excellent communication & presentation skills – the ability to dig into complex issues and then summarize in a clear, concise message to facilitate decisions and drive action;




Desired Skills:

SQL (preferred). Must have strong Excel skills if not
Demonstrated experience of key data analysis concepts thru creation of SQL queries (Oracle, Teradata, and/or MS-SQL) to analyze large, complex sets of data, and develop quantitative + qualitative analytical determinations
Knowledge and prior experience with Liquidity Reporting / Regulatory reporting
Basic working knowledge of Tableau
Strong knowledge and prior experience with Data Controls monitoring and/or Data Control governance practices
Banking or Financial Experience
Familiarity with BAC Enterprise Data Management Policy & Standards
Treasury background
Familiarity with ETL tools (Informatica)
BI Tools (PowerPivot, Tableau)
Reconciliation experience
Data Warehouse experience




Day to Day:




CFO DM is looking for a seasoned Data Management SME to join our Traded Products Team within CFO DM. Areas of focus will be supporting a mix of the following: 1) Perform Critical BAU Data review & analysis related activities across multiple Capital Calculator workstreams, 2) Capital Regulatory Projects/Initiatives, 3) Infrastructure Optimization/Operational Excellence (OpEx) work efforts and 5) Team Metrics Tracking & Management Status Reporting. This role will also be accountable for contributing execution subject matter expertise on important strategic & tactical data related issues that impact the team. Candidate needs to demonstrate a strong passion for Data Analytics and Data Remediation. This role will be responsible for helping to analyze data issues and drive change through collaboration and partnership with Business Partner and Technology teams.

Core functions are: knowing the data, sourcing the data and controlling the data. This includes analysis, design, data derivations, control design, translation of business requirements, issue management, audit/governance support and process/design documentation.

Candidates should have extensive work history in several of the following key responsibilities:

• Assume ownership of current CFO Data Management controls across multiple finance products. Ownership will include building, delivering and monitoring daily data controls essential for Regulatory Reporting.

• Unwind SQL and ETL layers in Oracle database to identify issues/root cause analysis, understand logic/derivations and work with internal and upstream tech partners to resolve issues in a timely fashion

• Generate daily and monthly reports on data quality breaks and data validation shifts outside of BAU thresholds

• Drives and participates in design, development and implementation of future Treasury data controls

• Data Control Governance - Ensuring process controls, data validation activities, and measurement processes remain timely and relevant

• Create and maintain required documentation and evidence to ensure adherence to EDM Standards and RDA requirements

• Work under minimal supervision on Corporate Treasury projects that require creative solutions under very tight deadlines

• Operational Excellence – Improving CFO Data Management functions for production, data governance, data change and regulatory/audit activities

• Change Management – Validates data and signs off on reports within test environments to confirm application accuracy, functionality and EDM Standards are met

• Manage relationships with diverse data partners and technology teams to support initiative work that demand aggressive timelines

• Collaborate with PMO Leads to and provide updates on project timelines, deliverables and obstacles / challenging

• Create reporting for senior management that proactively provides project status, issue / enhancement tracking and project implementation

We are seeking a Document Transition Specialist to join our cybersecurity and program management teams to facilitate the migration of documentation into a new automated tracking system while ensuring their completeness and accuracy. The ideal candidate will liaise with document approvers, coordinate with high-level personnel for document approvals, and maintain the organization within the new system. Attention to Detail
Strong Communication Skills

Title: Data Analyst (REMOTE) - Contractor Role
Description:
About Gridware

Gridware exists to enhance and protect the mother of all networks: the electrical grid. The grid touches everything and the consequences can be dire when it fails: wildfires burn, land is destroyed, property is damaged, and lives are lost.

Our team created an advanced sensing system to continuously analyze critical grid behavior. Utilizing high-precision sensor arrays and intelligence, our system identifies and preemptively mitigates faults. The technology has been proven with utilities to bolster safety, enhance reliability, and reduce outages. The demand for power will only increase. We protect the grid of today while we build the grid of tomorrow.

Gridware is privately held and backed by the best climate-tech and Silicon Valley investors. We are headquartered in San Francisco, California.

WHY do we need you?

At a pivotal moment in our growth, we've successfully deployed our innovative power grid monitoring devices across several regions, marking a significant milestone in our mission to enhance the safety and efficiency of power distribution networks worldwide. With the ambition to ensure uninterrupted, round-the-clock monitoring of our expanding fleet, we're looking to establish operational hubs in various countries. This strategic expansion aims to leverage global talent and time zone coverage to enhance our operations team's capability to vigilantly monitor our fleet of devices around the clock.

As an early team member of our operational centers, you're not just joining a company; you're joining a critical mission. You will play a pivotal role in monitoring the power grid, acting as the first line of defense against power line faults that could lead to catastrophic wildfires. Your efforts in real-time data analysis, anomaly detection, and critical event escalation will directly contribute to preventing potential disasters, ensuring fleet reliability, and safeguarding communities.

Responsibilities


Monitoring real-time data streams from field sensors and responding to alerts.
Consistently following SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures) to investigate and localize real-time faults with minimal error.
Quickly and efficiently working with Supervisors on ad-hoc data requests, and following up during ongoing investig


Requirements


STEM degree (science, technology, engineering, or mathematics)
Proficiency in English - must be able to efficiently communicate event information
Basic understanding of data analytics and anomaly detection
A passion for working in a fast-paced environment
Highly motivated, proactive, able to perform duties without supervision
Being willing to work night shifts and weekends
Ability to work 40 hours per week


Preferred Qualifications


Basic proficiency with Python programming
Research experience (STEM preferred)
Experience working with metadata or data annotation
Experience with real-time work and/or making reports


Benefits

Health, Dental & Vision (Gold and Platinum with some providers plans fully covered)

Paid parental leave

Alternating day off (every other Monday)

“Off the Grid”, a two week per year paid break for all employees.

Commuter allowance

Company-paid training

HTML:
About Gridware

Gridware exists to enhance and protect the mother of all networks: the electrical grid. The grid touches everything and the consequences can be dire when it fails: wildfires burn, land is destroyed, property is damaged, and lives are lost.

Our team created an advanced sensing system to continuously analyze critical grid behavior. Utilizing high-precision sensor arrays and intelligence, our system identifies and preemptively mitigates faults. The technology has been proven with utilities to bolster safety, enhance reliability, and reduce outages. The demand for power will only increase. We protect the grid of today while we build the grid of tomorrow.

Gridware is privately held and backed by the best climate-tech and Silicon Valley investors. We are headquartered in San Francisco, California.

WHY do we need you?

At a pivotal moment in our growth, we've successfully deployed our innovative power grid monitoring devices across several regions, marking a significant milestone in our mission to enhance the safety and efficiency of power distribution networks worldwide. With the ambition to ensure uninterrupted, round-the-clock monitoring of our expanding fleet, we're looking to establish operational hubs in various countries. This strategic expansion aims to leverage global talent and time zone coverage to enhance our operations team's capability to vigilantly monitor our fleet of devices around the clock.

As an early team member of our operational centers, you're not just joining a company; you're joining a critical mission. You will play a pivotal role in monitoring the power grid, acting as the first line of defense against power line faults that could lead to catastrophic wildfires. Your efforts in real-time data analysis, anomaly detection, and critical event escalation will directly contribute to preventing potential disasters, ensuring fleet reliability, and safeguarding communities.

Responsibilities

  • Monitoring real-time data streams from field sensors and responding to alerts.
  • Consistently following SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures) to investigate and localize real-time faults with minimal error.
  • Quickly and efficiently working with Supervisors on ad-hoc data requests, and following up during ongoing investig

Requirements

  • STEM degree (science, technology, engineering, or mathematics)
  • Proficiency in English - must be able to efficiently communicate event information
  • Basic understanding of data analytics and anomaly detection
  • A passion for working in a fast-paced environment
  • Highly motivated, proactive, able to perform duties without supervision
  • Being willing to work night shifts and weekends
  • Ability to work 40 hours per week

Preferred Qualifications

  • Basic proficiency with Python programming
  • Research experience (STEM preferred)
  • Experience working with metadata or data annotation
  • Experience with real-time work and/or making reports

Benefits

Health, Dental & Vision (Gold and Platinum with some providers plans fully covered)

Paid parental leave

Alternating day off (every other Monday)

“Off the Grid”, a two week per year paid break for all employees.

Commuter allowance

Company-paid training

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
MarshBerry is growing! We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our team. We have a people first, fast paced, collaborative culture with plenty of opportunity for growth. MarshBerry has been successful in achieving growth objectives because the trust our clients place in our talented team of professionals, and all MarshBerry colleagues play a critical role in directly or indirectly cultivating those trusted relationships. MarshBerry provides an environment where employees can learn, improve and realize their career goals. We offer competitive benefits, new challenges, and learning experiences.




Job Details

Position Summary:

MarshBerry is currently seeking a Data Analyst for our Beachwood, OH office. This position will work from the Beachwood, OH office four days per week with one flex day to work from home. The Data Analystwill be responsible for administration of MarshBerry’s proprietary database, assisting with product development, and research projects. The Data Analyst enters client data, produces reports, analyzes reports, and reviews results with clients. They will collaborate with the team on client projects and enhancements to performance benchmarking reports.




Responsibilities:

Serve as project manager for assigned clients and be responsible for data collection, formatting and report generation on a quarterly or annual basis.
Extract data and generate reports for special requests and projects.
Establish and maintain positive client relationships.
Assist with market research, surveys, client presentations, and various data analytics projects.
Assist with product development and enhancements to MarshBerry products and services.

Answer client inquiries regarding Intellectual Capital products and services.

Develop and update procedures on a continual basis.
Provide guidance to Analysts and Consultants on formatting of accounts, calculations of ratios, etc.
Train new team members and interns in Intellectual Capital processes and knowledge.
Complete projects in desired timeframe utilizing prioritization skills to keep multiple projects progressing on target.

Cultivate and maintain effective relationships with potential internal/external clients, partners and stakeholders that can directly or indirectly lead to revenue generation for all MarshBerry services.

Special projects and other tasks as assigned.




Selection Criteria

Education & Experience:

Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Accounting, Finance, Economics or Mathematics preferred or equivalent combination of education and experience.
At least 1 – 3 years of prior relevant experience including experience collecting and analyzing data. Experience working with financial data is preferred.
Understanding of data modeling in the financial services and insurance industry preferred.
High level of computer and software competency; proficient with database administration and infrastructure. Proficient in Microsoft Office Word, Excel, Access and PowerPoint.




Other:

Analytical, proactive problem solving skills; techniques to identify and resolve issues in a timely manner, gathers and analyzes information skillfully.
Strong customer service skills.
Confidentiality; maintains confidentiality of proprietary information and that of clients.
Strong communication skills; both written and verbal with demonstrated creativity with regard to work. Excellent spelling, grammar as well as good phone skills.
Exceptional organizational skills; using systematic methods to perform work and creativity to recommend or create new work methods or procedures.
Ability to multi task; able to complete projects and responsibilities with extreme attention to detail according to required timelines and deadlines, along with capacity to work under pressure to create accurate results, demonstrating accuracy and thoroughness and monitors works to ensure quality.
Must be able to work in the Beachwood, OH office four days per week with one flex day to work from home.




Working at MarshBerryWho We Are:MarshBerry practices The Collaborative Way which encourages employees to adhere to these five principles: listening generously, speaking straight, being for each other, acknowledgement & appreciation, and honoring commitments. We are committed to fostering an environment of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion. We strive to educate our current and potential employees in these areas, while continuing to promote a welcoming and inclusive environment for all.




What We Do:MarshBerry provides consulting services in the financial services industry primarily to independent insurance agents, brokers and carriers, as well as wealth and retirement plan advisors. Our services include but are not limited to financial, operational, sales management, merger and acquisition advisory, peer-to-peer exchange and information services. We are recognized in the financial services industry for providing innovative and customized solutions to our clients, with whom we build trusted advisor relationships. At MarshBerry, our mission is to help our clients learn, improve and realize their value. Our clients credit us for providing the vision, tools, and discipline to help them reach their strategic goals.




It’s one thing to be recognized as experts in our field, it is another to be noteworthy based on the sentiment and feedback of our team. MarshBerry has recently been awarded the following:

Crain’s Best Employers in Ohio

The Nation’s Best and Brightest in Wellness

North Coast 99

Top Work Places – The Plain Dealer

Weatherhead 100

West Michigan’s Best and Brightest Companies to Work for




To learn more about MarshBerry, visit www.marshberry.com.




We appreciate your interest in MarshBerry. As an equal opportunity employer, your application will be considered with regard to all laws which prohibit discrimination because of race, color, sex, religion, national origin, age, disability, military status, and genetic information, and requirements to take affirmative action in the hiring of minorities, including women, veterans, and those individuals with disabilities.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
As a Data Analyst for Natixis CIB Americas, you will play a pivotal role in driving data-informed decision-making across our operations. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to extract insights from complex datasets, supporting strategic initiatives and enhancing our competitive edge in the financial services landscape. Your expertise in data analysis and visualization will empower us to harness the full potential of data to optimize performance and meet our clients' needs. This position will also involve ensuring alignment with Head Office procedures and solutions in the Americas region.




The Data Analyst will be responsible for:

Analyzing large datasets from diverse sources to support various business functions.
Conducting exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities, and providing actionable insights that drive business strategies and improve operational efficiency.
Preparing data for dashboards, reports, and visualizations using tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Python, to present findings to stakeholders in a clear and impactful manner.
Transforming complex data into concise, goal-oriented reports that foster innovation and growth.
Identifying patterns and trends in datasets and delivering actionable insights to support strategic decision-making.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver tailored analytical solutions.
Partnering with Head Office and platform equivalents to align with global processes and solutions.
Creating and maintaining custom and periodic reports, visualizations, and dashboards for key stakeholders.
Working with business units, support functions, innovation teams, and technical teams to address data-related needs and explore opportunities for process improvement.
Troubleshooting data-related issues and collaborating to resolve discrepancies in datasets.
Developing and implementing data quality control processes to ensure accuracy, consistency, and reliability of data.
Interpreting and summarizing analytical findings, developing key takeaways, and presenting results clearly to stakeholders.
Ensuring that all data handling and analysis practices comply with regulatory requirements and internal policies, particularly regarding data privacy and security.
Staying informed of industry trends and emerging technologies in data analytics, and recommending innovative solutions to enhance our analytical capabilities.




Requirements

Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools such as Power BI.
Knowledge of programming languages such as Python, R, or SAS.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and critical-thinking skills with the ability to manage large datasets effectively.
Effective communication skills, capable of translating complex data findings into clear and actionable insights.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively, managing multiple projects under tight deadlines and competing priorities.
Deep understanding of banking systems, products, and processes, with the ability to effectively address related issues.
Ability to listen, interpret user needs, and apply knowledge to direct solutions.
Familiarity with statistical and machine learning techniques is a plus.
BA/BS in Data Management, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate information accurately and effectively.




Natixis is an equal opportunity employer, committed to a workplace free of discrimination. Natixis will not tolerate any form of discrimination based on age, color, mental or physical handicap or disability, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, alienage, ancestry or citizenship status, race, religion, sex (including sex stereotyping, gender identity, gender expression or transgender status), veteran status, creed, genetic information or carrier status, or any other protected characteristic as established by law.




Respect for all means that we deal with each person as an individual and not as a member of any group. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment. Management is expected to provide leadership in supporting the firms EEO program by taking steps to promote EEO in all facets of employment including recruitment, hiring, retention, promotion, performance assessment, and career-development opportunities.




The salary range for this position will be between $105,000 - $130,000. Natixis is required by law to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. Actual base salary will vary and will be based on several factors including, but not limited to, relevant experience, education, skills set, applicable licensure and certifications, and other business and organizational needs. Base salary is only one component of our total rewards package. Natixis also offers a generous benefits package, and you may be eligible for a discretionary incentive award depending on company and individual performance.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company

Qualcomm Technologies, Inc.

Job Area

Miscellaneous Group, Miscellaneous Group > Data Analyst

General Summary

Qualcomm is a company of inventors that unlocked 5G ushering in an age of rapid acceleration in connectivity and new possibilities that will transform industries, create jobs, and enrich lives. But this is just the beginning. It takes inventive minds with diverse skills, backgrounds, and cultures to transform 5Gs potential into world-changing technologies and products.

We are looking for a Data analyst to produce insights from the data through statistical analysis and modeling as required. Candidate will be part of a global cross-functional team that’s responsible for the large-scale data analysis and operational analytics for Qualcomm engineering teams.

As a Data Analyst, you should be experienced in exploratory analysis, deriving insights using statistical analysis and probabilistic estimation techniques. Proficiency in querying/transforming large datasets data and visualizing datasets to present the story from data is required.

Minimum Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Engineering/Statistics/Operations Research with 3+ years or Master’s degree in Engineering/Statistics/Operations Research with 1+ years of relevant experience in data analytics and statistical modeling
Strong knowledge of SQL, Python (relevant packages for statistical analysis, modeling)
Working knowledge of experiment design and hypothesis testing
Database structure, SQL, querying: Ability to join data and query across multiple sources, understanding how data structure can be improved.
Reporting and visualization: Proficiency in Tableau or Power BI, pivot tables, and creating dashboards that meet internal customer needs.



Responsibilities


Query bigdata system and analyze terabytes of data to deliver on complex analytical deep dives to deliver insights
Build statistical models to be able to perform descriptive, inferential, and predictive analytics to identify trends and relationships
Define and conduct statistical hypothesis testing to ensure data reliability and soundness during all stages of processing and analysis
Create data visualizations to present derived insights and build out operational visualizations to measure trend drifts and outliers



Preferred Qualifications


Experience with statistical techniques such as statistical inference, time series modeling, experiment design and feature engineering
Proficient with Python programming for data analysis (relevant packages)
Experience with querying and analyzing large scale data sets
Good understanding of classification, clustering, regression models.
Proficient with relational and non-relational databases
Demonstrated experience in visually communicating insights
Demonstrated experience in building analytical dashboards
Experience with Object oriented programming, GIT or other version control systems
Excellent communication and teamwork skills
An analytical mind and quick objective decision making ability
Experience with Modin/Vaex, Dask or PySpark, Plotly is a plus
Passion for machine learning and predictive modeling
Experience working in a distributed team and communicating across geographic boundaries
Understanding of probabilities (probability modeling, Bayes rule): Understanding the math behind joint vs conditional probabilities for lead time modeling and projections.
Ability to prove statistical significance (t-tests, ANOVAs, etc.): Ability to identify statistically significant factors affecting outcomes.
Ability to prove causation: Ability to separate correlation from causation and demonstrate the impact of efforts on company performance.
Simulation: Ability to simulate scenarios to fill gaps where data is sparse or messy.
Optimization modeling: Ability to model decision scenarios and prove the best possible choice for complex problems.
Predictive modeling: Ability to use linear and logistic regression to identify relevant variables and communicate their impact on desired outcomes.



Applicants: Qualcomm is an equal opportunity employer. If you are an individual with a disability and need an accommodation during the application/hiring process, rest assured that Qualcomm is committed to providing an accessible process. You may e-mail disability-accomodations@qualcomm.com or call Qualcomm's toll-free number found here. Upon request, Qualcomm will provide reasonable accommodations to support individuals with disabilities to be able participate in the hiring process. Qualcomm is also committed to making our workplace accessible for individuals with disabilities. (Keep in mind that this email address is used to provide reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities. We will not respond here to requests for updates on applications or resume inquiries).

To all Staffing and Recruiting Agencies: Our Careers Site is only for individuals seeking a job at Qualcomm. Staffing and recruiting agencies and individuals being represented by an agency are not authorized to use this site or to submit profiles, applications or resumes, and any such submissions will be considered unsolicited. Qualcomm does not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from agencies. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Qualcomm employees or any other company location. Qualcomm is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes/applications.

EEO Employer: Qualcomm is an equal opportunity employer; all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or any other protected classification.

Qualcomm expects its employees to abide by all applicable policies and procedures, including but not limited to security and other requirements regarding protection of Company confidential information and other confidential and/or proprietary information, to the extent those requirements are permissible under applicable law.

Pay Range And Other Compensation & Benefits

$82,400.00 - $123,600.00

The above pay scale reflects the broad, minimum to maximum, pay scale for this job code for the location for which it has been posted. Even more importantly, please note that salary is only one component of total compensation at Qualcomm. We also offer a competitive annual discretionary bonus program and opportunity for annual RSU grants (employees on sales-incentive plans are not eligible for our annual bonus). In addition, our highly competitive benefits package is designed to support your success at work, at home, and at play. Your recruiter will be happy to discuss all that Qualcomm has to offer – and you can review more details about our US benefits at this link.

If you would like more information about this role, please contact Qualcomm Careers.

Even more importantly, please note that salary is only one component of total compensation at Qualcomm. We also offer a competitive annual discretionary bonus program and opportunity for annual RSU grants (employees on sales-incentive plans are not eligible for our annual bonus). In addition, our highly competitive benefits package is designed to support your success at work, at home, and at play. Your recruiter will be happy to discuss all that Qualcomm has to offer – and you can review more details about our US benefits at this link.

If you would like more information about this role, please contact Qualcomm Careers.

Title: Data Analyst (F/H)
Description:
Nous recherchons un Data Analyst, pour un CDD de 12 mois, passionné par les données et les outils de visualisation pour rejoindre notre équipe. Le candidat idéal aura une connaissance approfondie de Power BI et sera capable de travailler en étroite collaboration avec nos Business Analysts pour les aider à constituer leurs propres jeux de données et tableaux de bord.

Ce poste nécessite une forte capacité d'écoute et une aptitude à partager ses connaissances de manière pédagogique.


Savencia est un groupe alimentaire international, familial et indépendant, imprégné de valeurs d'entreprise fortes et d'une vocation : " Entreprendre pour mieux nourrir l'homme ". Avec plus de 23.000 employés dans 34 pays, Savencia développe des produits innovants de haute qualité qui sont principalement commercialisés dans la distribution et la restauration.

Savencia croit fermement en l'égalité professionnelle entre les femmes et les hommes et à la combinaison de la parentalité avec les ambitions professionnelles de chacun. Cet engagement, inscrit dans sa feuille de route « Vers un socle sociétal », se traduit par des actions concrètes visant à :
- Assurer un environnement de travail sain et améliorer la qualité de vie de nos employés.
- Promouvoir des parcours professionnels équitables et faciliter l'accès aux emplois pour tous.
- Soutenir la parentalité en permettant une meilleure conciliation entre vie professionnelle et vie personnelle.
- Adopter une politique volontariste de non-discrimination et d'égalité des chances à l'embauche.


Le Groupe SAVENCIA est composé de deux entités : SAVENCIA Fromage & Dairy, acteur majeur de la transformation laitière et 5ème fabricant mondial de fromages avec des marques fortes, et SAVENCIA Gourmet, acteur international du Food Service Premium, également présent dans la distribution et les magasins et spécialisé dans la gastronomie sucrée / chocolat, la charcuterie et les marques de produits de la mer.


Pour en savoir plus : https://www.savencia.com/


En tant que futur Data Analyst, vous serez en charge de :


Collaborer avec les Business Analysts pour comprendre leurs besoins en matière de données et de reporting.

Co-créer et co-maintenir des tableaux de bord et des rapports Power BI pour répondre aux besoins des différentes unités métier.

Assurer la qualité et l'intégrité des données utilisées dans les rapports et tableaux de bord.

Former et accompagner les Business Analysts dans l'utilisation de Power BI pour qu'ils puissent devenir autonomes.

Participer à la définition et à la mise en œuvre des meilleures pratiques en matière de gouvernance des données.

Travailler en étroite collaboration avec le Data Product Owner pour aligner les initiatives de données avec les objectifs stratégiques de l'entreprise.



Avantages :

Environnement de travail stimulant et collaboratif.

Opportunités de développement professionnel et de formation continue.

Participation à des projets innovants et stratégiques pour l'entreprise.




Formation : Bac+5 en informatique, statistiques, data science ou domaine connexe.

Expérience : Une première expérience en tant que Data Analyst ou dans un rôle similaire est un plus, mais les candidats débutants avec une forte appétence pour les données et les outils de visualisation sont également encouragés à postuler.

Compétences techniques :

Maîtrise d'outil Business Intelligence tel que PowerBi ou équivalent (création de rapports, tableaux de bord, DAX, Power Query, Data Visualisation).
Connaissance des bases de données relationnelles et des langages SQL.
Compréhension des concepts de gouvernance des données et de qualité des données.

Compétences interpersonnelles :

Excellentes capacités d'écoute et de communication.
Aptitude à expliquer des concepts techniques de manière claire et pédagogique.
Capacité à travailler en équipe et à collaborer avec des profils variés.
Esprit analytique et rigoureux, orienté vers la résolution de problèmes.
Show more

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
Are we the best-kept secret in Málaga?

We like to think so. Over the past year, our Málaga hub has grown into a thriving center of excellence, where we combine innovation, collaboration, and opportunity. We are serious about finding the right people and are confident that we have a lot to offer.


The role in a nutshell

Are you passionate about leveraging data to make meaningful business improvements? As a Business Data Analyst within the Coupa Global Reporting & Governance team, you will be instrumental in enabling datadriven decision-making and fostering continuous improvement. Your goal? To turn data insights into actionable strategies that enhance contract compliance, boost supplier performance, and streamline operational efficiency. In this role, you will collaborate closely with diverse stakeholders, acting as a vital link between business needs and technical capabilities. Your responsibilities will include gathering and validating business requirements, translating them into technical specifications, and ensuring user-friendly reporting solutions meet organizational goals. You will uphold best practices in data quality, work towards impactful reporting outcomes, and create a data-driven culture across our global Coupa landscape. With opportunities for growth in a stimulating and innovative environment, you will develop cost-saving initiatives, enhance business processes, and maintain compliance with audit requirements. If you thrive on advancing improvements through data and working in a collaborative global team, this role is your next career move!


More specifically, you will be expected to:

• Analyze trends and patterns in Power BI reports to identify areas for improvement, such as contract compliance and supplier performance;

• Monitor catalogue growth and drive initiatives to increase on-catalogue purchasing and reduce offcatalogue spend;

• Evaluate purchasing trends to enhance contract compliance and support cost-saving strategies;

• Track payment schedules to maximize early payment discounts and optimize cost efficiency;

• Implement initiatives to reduce cycle times for requisitions, invoice processing, and supplier onboarding;

• Advocate for electronic invoicing to improve accuracy and streamline processes;

• Gather, validate, and document business requirements for reporting projects;

• Support data standardization efforts to enhance reporting accuracy and consistency;

• Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure reporting solutions align with strategic goals;

• Develop training programs and user guides to empower end users in utilizing reports effectively


Do you have what it takes?

• Skilled at interpreting data and providing actionable business insights;

• Advanced skills in Power BI and Excel; SAP experience is beneficial.

• Solid interpersonal and communication skills to engage with and collaborate efficiently across teams;

• High accuracy and a focus on maintaining data quality in reporting outputs;

• Quick to identify and address operational and technical issues;

• Significant experience in increasing efficiencies and optimizing workflows;

• Experience working across procurement, finance, or accounts payable functions;

• Ability to develop and deliver clear training materials for diverse user groups.


Language : As you will be part of a global team, you are expected to communicate fluently in English (verbal and written). Knowledge of other languages such as French, German, or Spanish is favorable but not mandatory.


Travel: Some occasional travelling will be required.


Location: This role will ideally be based at our Malaga office, but we could consider other suitable locations


Wondering what’s in it for you?

🆙 Be part of a world class organization with a mandate to identify opportunities for improvement and drive performance benefits

🏠 Hybrid Work

💰 Competitive compensation structure

👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Health Insurance coverage for you and your dependents

🛟 Life Insurance

📈 Growth Opportunities (career progression, tuition assistance, language courses, training and certifications, etc.)

🛬 Relocation assistance


If you are ready to join our diverse team, make a difference and advance your career in a global setting, we want to hear from you.

Join us and help shape the future of data-driven procurement and finance processes! Given the global nature of the role, we ask applicants to submit their resume in English and indicate their working rights status.

Glencore encourages diversity and provides an inclusive workplace.

Accommodations are available upon request for applicants with special needs.

Interviews may start prior to the closing date.

Title: Junior Data Analyst (SQL)
Description:
We offer:




• Become a member of a dynamic team which support Wealth Managements strategic objectives through the use and exploitation of its data and analytical assets

• International/multinational environment: team in Budapest Office works closely with the New York office.

• Collaborative creative environment

• Contingent/Leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley

• Contract via 3rd party agency




You will:




• Partner extensively with other teams and business partners within and outside the department (such as sales, marketing, product owners, data science and data visualization teams) to deliver business solutions and support decision making

• Liaise with Technology partners to understand the data source and suggest enhancements as needed

• Utilize proactive problem-solving and innovative thinking to address challenges

• Build, monitor and review data models and conduct analyses based on specific requirements

• Provide analytics and insight for various business initiatives and projects

• Prepare and deliver presentations to highlight important metrics and showcase achievements

• Create relevant documentation where needed

• Assist in the development of Tableau dashboards and data visualizations for reporting to senior management and business users including Financial Advisors




You have:




• 0-3 years data analytics experience

• Bachelor’s or higher degree in Business Management or Economics or IT or Data Science

• Tech skills: SQL/Python/R

• Strong analytical mindset

• Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills

• Detail oriented and ability to handle, prioritize multiple tasks simultaneously

• Passion for providing help to navigate through complex decisions for clients

• Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills

• Great presentation skills




You might also have:




• Background in the Financial Services Industry, with an emphasis on wealth management

• Experience working with technology teams closely

• Experience in data modelling and visualization technologies, such as: Dataiku, Python, Tableau, PowerBI, QlikView




Team Profile:




The Analytics & Data (A&D) organization is a key growth area within Morgan Stanley’s Wealth Management Division, playing a critical role in the execution of the wider Wealth Management strategy. The use of analytics and data will be a key driver in accelerating growth across all client segments, enabling data-driven decision making and delivering the best client experience.




About us:




Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services.

At Morgan Stanley Budapest, we are shaping the future of our global business and contributing to our local community. Our team works across numerous areas, including Technology, Mathematical Modelling, Finance, Risk Management, Wealth Management, and Data & Analytics from our state-of-the-art offices near the Danube and our City Gate office in the heart of the City Centre.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Rejoignez Learnation et devenez acteur d’une Edtech en pleine croissance !




✨ Qui sommes-nous ?

Chez Learnation Group, nous avons une ambition claire : révolutionner les solutions d’apprentissage linguistique. Notre groupe dynamique (150 collaborateurs) et en pleine expansion rassemble quatre sociétés complémentaires basées en France (Paris et Rouen), en Italie et au Maroc, qui forment un écosystème unique :

💼 7Speaking : Des offres conçues pour les RH et les entreprises, permettant à leurs collaborateurs de développer leurs compétences linguistiques et d’exceller dans un environnement professionnel international

🎓 PrepMyFuture : La référence dans la préparation aux certifications linguistiques (TOEIC, TOEFL, IELTS, etc.), grâce à des outils pédagogiques performants et accessibles

🌟 Educastream : Des solutions de formation linguistique personnalisées, adaptées aux besoins des particuliers pour les accompagner dans leur apprentissage et leur progression

🚀 Learnation : Le groupe visionnaire qui pilote l’ensemble, assure la cohérence stratégique et stimule l’innovation pour transformer l’apprentissage linguistique




Ensemble, nous aidons des milliers d’apprenants et d’organisations à maîtriser les langues, à explorer de nouvelles opportunités et à s’ouvrir au monde.




Notre philosophie ?

💡 Innovation : Être à la pointe des solutions et méthodes d’apprentissage.

🌍 Impact : Améliorer concrètement la vie de nos apprenants et de nos partenaires.

🏆 Performance : Obtenir des résultats mesurables, tout en visant l’excellence.




🌟 Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?

Une société en croissance : participez à une aventure entrepreneuriale passionnante
Une culture collaborative : tous les collaborateurs ont une voix qui compte et un rôle clé dans notre succès
Un impact tangible : chaque projet transforme la vie de nos clients
Une vision internationale : apprenez et collaborez avec des acteurs du monde entier.




Nous souhaitons intégrer des talents prêts à dépasser leurs limites, à innover et à rejoindre une entreprise où vos idées comptent vraiment. Que vous soyez expert dans votre domaine ou en quête d’une nouvelle aventure, Learnation Group vous offre un cadre idéal pour grandir et exceller.




🚀 Le contexte :

Nous recherchons un(e) Data Analyst prêt(e) à nous aider à tirer le meilleur de l’utilisation de nos données, sous la direction de notre CTPO. Ce rôle est clé pour soutenir la croissance de Learnation et renforcer sa position de leader dans le domaine des solutions linguistiques




Nous recherchons des talents prêts à dépasser leurs limites, à innover et à rejoindre une entreprise où vos idées comptent vraiment. Que vous soyez expert dans votre domaine ou en quête d’une nouvelle aventure, Learnation vous offre un cadre idéal pour grandir et exceller.













🛠️ Le rôle : Data Analyst




Missions principales :

Collecter, analyser et interpréter les données provenant de diverses sources pour fournir des insights exploitables.
Créer et maintenir des tableaux de bord et des rapports permettant de suivre les performances et les KPIs.
Collaborer avec les équipes produit, marketing, opérations, pédagogie, ventes, tech etc. pour identifier les besoins en données et fournir des analyses supportant les décisions stratégiques.
Collaborer avec les équipes techniques pour répondre aux usages fonctionnels tout en assurant la disponibilité et la sécurité des données conformément aux exigences internes et réglementaires
Assurer la qualité et l’intégrité des données, en mettant en place des processus de validation et de nettoyage.
Utiliser des outils de visualisation pour présenter les données de manière claire et compréhensible.
Mettre en place une stratégie de données globale pour guider les initiatives de collecte, d'analyse et d'utilisation des données.
Promouvoir une culture data au sein de l'organisation.




🎯 Ce que nous recherchons :

Minimum de 4 ans d'expérience en tant que Data Analyst ou dans un poste similaire, de préférence dans des entreprises utilisant un modèle SaaS.
Solide expérience avec les bases de données (MSSQL, PostgreSQL, MySQL) et de visualisation (Tableau, Power BI, etc.).
Connaissance approfondie des méthodologies statistiques et de modélisation des données.




✅ Votre profil idéal :

Excellente collaboration et communication avec les autres équipes.
Force de proposition et créativité.
Capacité de synthèse et rigueur analytique.




🎁 Ce que nous offrons :

Des opportunités d’évolution : la croissance rapide du groupe crée de nombreuses opportunités
Une flexibilité de l’organisation du travail : un accord de télétravail autorise jusqu’à 2 jours par semaine à distance
De nombreux avantages : RTT, carte titres restaurant, mutuelle responsable prise en charge à 100 % (y compris famille), cadre de travail agréable, accessible et central (Paris 8e), accès à nos plateformes de formation linguistique et à un portail de réduction/d’avantages salariés, évènements internes.




⚙️ Processus de recrutement :

Nous avons conçu un processus clair et humain pour identifier les meilleurs talents :

Echange téléphonique puis entretien visio avec Laurent, notre Responsable Recrutement, pour échanger sur votre parcours, vos attentes et vos motivations.
Entretien avec notre CPTO pour explorer votre expertise et vos ambitions.
Cas d’étude à réaliser, permettant d’évaluer vos compétences techniques et stratégiques.
Rencontre avec des membres du CODIR.







📣 Prêt(e) à nous rejoindre ?

Envoyez-nous votre candidature à : laurent.thienot@learnation.group et diane.monin@learnation.group

Vous voulez en savoir plus ? Consultez notre site : https://www.learnation.group/




🙌 Partagez cette offre !

Si ce poste n’est pas pour vous mais que vous connaissez quelqu’un qui correspond, n’hésitez pas à partager cette annonce !

Show more

Nous avons conçu un processus clair et humain pour identifier les meilleurs talents :

  1. Echange téléphonique puis entretien visio avec Laurent, notre Responsable Recrutement, pour échanger sur votre parcours, vos attentes et vos motivations.
  2. Entretien avec notre CPTO pour explorer votre expertise et vos ambitions.
  3. Cas d’étude à réaliser, permettant d’évaluer vos compétences techniques et stratégiques.
  4. Rencontre avec des membres du CODIR.



📣 Prêt(e) à nous rejoindre ?

Envoyez-nous votre candidature à : laurent.thienot@learnation.group et diane.monin@learnation.group

Vous voulez en savoir plus ? Consultez notre site : https://www.learnation.group/


🙌 Partagez cette offre !

Si ce poste n’est pas pour vous mais que vous connaissez quelqu’un qui correspond, n’hésitez pas à partager cette annonce !

Title: Data analyst in controlling
HTML:
For over a decade, the Bosch Cluj Plant has become a strategic hub for innovation and production, making a significant impact on the technological landscape in Romania. Through our constant commitment to excellence in quality and innovation, we develop a diverse range of modern products for the mobility industry, focusing on delivering cutting-edge solutions to our international customers. Inspired by passion for technology, we have consistently evolved, solidifying our position as the most desired employer in Cluj for the engineering and business candidates. We pay special attention to the development of our community, inspiring future generations and governing our impact on the environment.

Our promise to our colleagues is rock-solid: we grow together, we enjoy our work, and inspire each other. Join us and see the difference.

Work



Job Description

Job Description

Are you driven to unlock the power of data and translate it into strategic insights? Are you passionate about digital transformation? Our cutting-edge manufacturing plant is searching for a data whiz to join our team! As we embrace Industry 4.0 and become a data-driven powerhouse, you'll play a key role in crafting informative reports and dashboards using Tableau and PowerBI. We need someone who will understand our business inside and out, and can design and implement BI solutions that fuel smart decision-making. You'll be a data maestro, wrangling information from various sources like our ERP (SAP), MES, and data warehouse to paint a clear picture through KPIs.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and maintain scalable and insightful BI reports and dashboards using Tableau, PowerBI, and other relevant BI tools;
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams to gather and define data requirements that align with business goals, ensuring accurate representation of data in BI reports;
  • Understand and analyze data from our ERP (SAP), MES, and various local solutions, integrating them effectively to provide comprehensive insights;
  • Continuously enhance data collection methods to improve efficiency and accuracy, supporting the creation of a robust data warehouse for KPI reporting;
  • Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets, providing actionable insights to stakeholders;
  • Manage the deployment of BI solutions, ensuring they are user-friendly and accessible to all relevant parties within the organization;
  • Stay abreast of the latest industry trends and advancements in BI technology, recommending improvements to tools and processes;
  • Facilitate training and support for users of BI tools across the organization, fostering a data-driven culture;





Qualifications

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Data Analytics, or a related field;
  • Proven experience as a Data Analyst or Business Intelligence Analyst, with extensive experience in designing and implementing BI solutions.;
  • Expertise in BI tools such as Tableau and PowerBI is essential;
  • Strong understanding of ERP systems, preferably SAP, MES, and data warehouse technologies;
  • Proficient in SQL and experience in querying databases, data manipulation, and analysis;
  • Ability to work with large, complex data sets and transform them into insightful business information;
  • Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy;
  • Strong communication skills, capable of conveying complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders;
  • Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a team environment as well as independently;
  • Proactive, curious, and innovative, with a strong problem-solving aptitude;

Additional Information

Benefits:

  • 25 days of annual leave – because your work-life balance is essential to us
  • Annual performance bonus up to two salaries – we appreciate your contribution to the company’s success
  • Annual salary review – we want you to feel fairly compensated for your hard work and dedication
  • Gift tickets worth 300 RON for Christmas and Easter
  • Flexible benefits – you will benefit from a monthly benefit budget that offers the possibility to customize the benefits package to suit your individual needs and preferences (You can opt for meal tickets worth 30 RON for every worked day or you can benefit from cultural tickets, gift tickets, or vacation vouchers, and discounts at restaurants, dentistry, shops, and many more)
  • Referral bonus - we encourage you to refer new candidates and you will be rewarded for it
  • Relocation package – we are committed to providing a supportive and inclusive work environment, so if you are recruited from another county, you will receive a special relocation bonus for 2 years which will help you to get settled in Cluj
  • Lunch discount – we have two canteens within our plant where you can eat your lunch at subsidized price
  • Flexible working hours – so that you can balance you work and personal obligations more effectively
  • Ability to work from the satellite Bosch location in Cluj-Napoca when it’s more convenient for you to do so
  • Home Office policy – you will benefit from a hybrid working model which takes into consideration the needs of each department in the plant and offers you the possibility to work from home when it is practical and convenient for you
  • Private medical insurance because health is a priority to us
  • Development Trainings - we have our own team of dedicated trainers that are providing specific trainings for personal and professional growth. In addition to this, we provide local development programs for Project Managers, Line Managers and Experts, external trainings, and assignments opportunities
  • Language courses – if your role demands it, you will have the chance to enhance your language skill set internally
  • Inspiring working conditions – we are committed to providing our employees a positive and fulfilling work experience
  • Transportation - to and from the Bosch Cluj Plant

Application Process

After you followed all the required steps on our platform, you will receive an e-mail for GDPR compliance.

Only those applicants who give their agreement will receive feedback from us.

Any other questions? Feel free to e-mail me at ioana.ilea@ro.bosch.com I will be back with an answer shortly.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Randstad Talent Selection è la specialty che si occupa di Ricerca & Selezione di professionisti qualificati.


Per azienda cliente di Fontanelle (TV), siamo alla ricerca di un:


DATA ANALYST


Si offre: inserimento diretto in azienda e retribuzione proporzionata all'esperienza maturata.


Sede di lavoro: Fontanelle (TV)


Di cosa ti occuperai?


Il Data Analyst inserito, collaborando con un consulente esterno e rispondendo alla Direzione Generale, si occuperà di:


  • supportare numericamente la Direzione Aziendale nella comprensione della dinamiche di gestione;
  • comprendere, tradurre e spiegare in dati problematiche operative;
  • organizzare e raccogliere dati ciclici di routine reporting, attingendo da fonti interne diverse;
  • attività di aggiornamento periodico degli obiettivi qualitativi Direzionali.


Quali requisiti stiamo cercando?


  • Laurea in discipline scientifiche preferibilmente ad indirizzo matematico/statistico;
  • esperienza pregressa, di almeno 3 anni, nel ruolo;
  • ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese;
  • preferibile, non necessaria, conoscenza della lingua spagnola;
  • preferibile conoscenza di SAP;
  • ottima conoscenza del pacchetto Office;
  • conoscenza di programmi gestione dati.


--

La ricerca è rivolta ai candidati ambosessi (L.903/77). Ti preghiamo di leggere l'informativa sulla privacy ai sensi dell'art. 13 del Regolamento (UE) 2016/679 sulla protezione dei dati (GDPR) sul sito https://www.randstad.it/privacy/

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

🔍 Turn Data into Stories. Drive Business Impact. Shape the Future.




Who We Are

We are a fast-growing startup revolutionizing executive talent scouting for the pharmaceutical industry. Our mission? To find the best executive talents on the planet for Pharma leaders. As our Data Analyst, you won’t just crunch numbers—you’ll bring data to life, empowering strategic decisions for both our company and our clients, including major Big Pharma players.




What You’ll Do

Master Our Business First

Before stepping into the Data Analyst role, you will first work as an Executive Search Associate
This means learning how we identify and evaluate top executive talent
You’ll gain hands-on experience in Pharma recruitment to truly understand the data you’ll be working with
Once you’ve mastered the business, you’ll transition into a full-time Data Analyst position

📊 Data Storytelling & Insights

Transform raw data into actionable insights using Power BI and Excel
Craft compelling data stories that help drive business decisions
Use Power Query & DAX to optimize reports and dashboards

🎤 Engage & Influence

Lead data-driven workshops for C-level stakeholders
Make complex data clear, persuasive, and actionable for executives
Serve as the bridge between data and strategy

🚀 Own the Data. Build the Future.

Our startup is scaling fast, and so is our data
This role has a clear growth path to becoming Responsible of the Data for our company
You'll have the opportunity to manage our data projects related some of the biggest pharmaceutical clients in the world




Who You Are

✔️ A Data Wizard – Power BI, Power Query, and DAX knowledge is a big plus

✔️ Excel Guru – Pivot tables, advanced formulas, automation—you speak Excel fluently

✔️ A Business-Minded Analyst – You don’t just analyze data; you understand the story behind the numbers

✔️ A Communicator – You can make data come alive for senior stakeholders

✔️ A Fast Learner – You’re excited to dive into the world of executive search first

✔️ A Growth-Minded Professional – Ready to take ownership and scale with us




Why Join Us?

💡 Real impact – Your insights will shape business decisions at the highest level

🌍 Exciting industry – Work with top-tier pharma leaders and global clients

📈 Fast career growth – A rare opportunity to become Head of Data in a high-growth startup

🤝 Collaborative culture – Work directly with leadership, no corporate nonsense

Ready to embrace the challenge, learn the business, and lead data strategy? 🚀 Apply now!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analyst

Location: Galway

Duration: 6 month contract




~Must based or be within a commutable distance to Galway for onsite work~.




Our client, a global investment solutions company, are looking for a data analyst to join their team on a contract basis. You will join a team whose main objective is to focus on the provision of Core and Common validation services along with developing reports and analytics for Squads and Business Units, providing meaningful and impactful metrics.




Skills and Expertise

Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a technology related field (e.g. Engineering, Computer Software, BIS, IT).
Minimum of 5+ years experience contributing to significant data or BI related projects in the areas of requirements gathering, data analysis and interpretation.
Prior experience working with cloud data warehouse platforms such as Snowflake with an awareness of its data lifecycle, data movement and access architecture.
Experience with the authoring and execution of SQL data queries and the ability to summarize or draw conclusions from data.
Strong data analysis experience in proactively analysing and solving data issues to support requirements gathering, data modelling and reporting.
Good interpersonal and communication skills with experience of working in cross-team collaborations and partnerships across a variety of multi-functional squads and product teams.
Experience delivering high value actionable BI reporting. Prior experience or certification in Power BI an advantage.
Good understanding of agile team methodologies.
This role will involve working with highly sensitive data and requires meticulous attention to detail to ensure the confidentiality, integrity and compliance of the data.
Production support / quick turnaround of analysis results to support real-time processing.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
About REVER

Shoppers receive any purchase in 24h anywhere on the planet. Why can’t we also return & get refunded just as quickly? REVER is born to change how the world buys by giving superpowers to shoppers, because returning should be as easy as buying. We automate returns, refunds, and exchanges for ecommerce businesses across the globe. After being backed by Y-Combinator, market leading VCs and top founders from unicorns in Europe, we are now growing 10x yearly and expanding to more and more countries. To accelerate our growth even further, we are looking for game-changers to join our team.

We are like a sports team; we create an environment where everyone can give their max and we push each other to achieve our potential. We are data driven problem solvers, but most importantly fast learners. You’ll immerse yourself in a vibrant, youthful atmosphere with a lot of potential to grow internally.

You Will


Be part of the Product Automations team at REVER, which is in the center of Logistics, Operations, Finance, Data Analytics and Tech teams.
Be involved in the product and roadmap definition process to solve customer needs.
Interact with REVER clients and REVER internal Teams to understand their requests, needs & priorities
Make data-driven decisions to prioritize initiatives and be fast on their execution.
Implement solutions to our core product (both internal and external)
Build MVPs to validate new business opportunities


You Have


Analytical and data-driven mindset
Curious and open to challenge/ be challenged
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Ability to solve problems and make quick and effective decisions
Ready to engage yourself 100% in this adventure
You are a team player who inspires trust, are ready to take the initiative, and is distinguished by a customer-satisfaction-driven attitude;
You are interested in a start-up environment, you are proactive and ready to share your ideas to continue building the best product in the market


Why join us


Be at the forefront of scaling REVER.
Join a fast-growing, dynamic company with strong backing from top-tier investors.
Work alongside an international, passionate team in the heart of Barcelona.
Help shape the future of e-commerce and revolutionize the returns experience for customers around Europe.
Show more
