Title: Analista de Visualización de Datos Junior
Description:
Buscamos un Analista de Visualización de Datos con formación en ingeniería, habilidades intermedias en Power BI y Excel, y un nivel intermedio de inglés. Este profesional será responsable de desarrollar informes detallados y cuadros de mando de KPI para clientes, con un enfoque en análisis y claridad visual.




Responsabilidades:

Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener dashboards interactivos en Power BI.

Elaborar informes detallados y cuadros de mando de KPI que faciliten la toma de decisiones para los clientes.

Analizar datos y generar insights para mejorar la interpretación de los informes.

Colaborar con los clientes para entender sus necesidades de reportes y personalizarlos según sus requisitos.

Gestionar y organizar datos utilizando Excel, asegurando la calidad y consistencia de la información.

Identificar oportunidades de mejora en los procesos de análisis y visualización de datos.




Requisitos:

Formación en Ingeniería (o equivalente).

Experiencia con Power BI y Excel (1-2 años)

Nivel intermedio de inglés (capacidad para leer, redactar y mantener conversaciones básicas).

Habilidades analíticas y atención al detalle.

Capacidad para trabajar de manera autónoma y en equipo.

Show more

Title: Reporting Analyst
Description:
Job Summary: We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Reporting Analyst to join our Digital & IT team at IONWAY. The ideal candidate will be responsible for the end-to-end process to deliver business relevant reporting, starting with the requirements gathering through to the delivery of reports based on Microsoft PowerBI.




Key Responsibilities:

Critically analyze and challenge business requirements to understand the real needs.
Translate business needs into documented data models by identifying underlying systems and data fields.
Create visually powerful and insightful PowerBI reports.
Collaborate with the corporate IS team to define additional data pipelines when data is not available in the data lake.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity in all reports and data models.
Continuously improve reporting processes and methodologies.
Provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis to support business decision-making.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Business, Data Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Reporting Analyst or similar role.
Strong proficiency in PowerBI and data modelling.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
Attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with data lakes and data pipeline development.
Familiarity with corporate IS systems and processes.
Advanced knowledge of SQL and other data manipulation languages.




What can you expect working with us:

Full-time job in a hybrid system (3 days in the office - 2 days in Wrocław, 1 day in Nysa, 2 days remote).
Flexible start hours (07:00-09:00).
Annual bonus.
Benefits package including: commuting cost reimbursement, life insurance, sports card - Medicover Sport, unlimited access to coffee and tea.
Access to private medical care (Luxmed) - cost covered by the employer.
Fully funded training for additional qualifications (possibility to learn selected foreign languages during work hours).
Active participation in creating the work environment in a newly established facility.
Values we take seriously: Collaboration / Operational Excellence / Respect / Responsibility / Positivity / Entrepreneurial Spirit.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
You have a design-thinking mindset to create simple and useful solutions. You have good interpersonal skills with an ability to collaborate with both business and technical resources and drive shared alignment on a solution. You have a fun, energetic personality that works well in a fast-paced environment with expectations to delivery high-impact value to the company.




• Minimum Requirements: (“Must have” Qualifications)

1. 2+ years of data analytics and business analysis experience

2. Solid experience building and maintaining dashboards, specifically Tableau.

3. Working knowledge of DB environments like snowflake and SQL are a plus

4. Ability to work with a varied community to understand requirements; the ability to "ask the right questions"; a focus on results with strong prioritization skills




• Desired Skills/Qualifications/System Experience requirements: (“Nice to have Qualifications”)

1. Possess excellent collaboration and communications skills

2. Have the ability to effectively influence business partners as well as colleagues due to the matrixed nature of the company.

3. The individual must be a strong team player, capable of dealing with complex issues and should be able to present effectively to delivery managers.

4. Flexibility is key as the role may evolve with changing business needs.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We have partnered with a global organisation on this exciting opportunity. The successful data analyst will support internal projects across multiple areas, gathering market intelligence and data to assist in developing strategies and driving cost efficiencies.




This is a permanent role with a hybrid working model. This would suit someone with 5 years plus of data experience and you would need to be based in Cork.




Key Responsibilities:

Provide live, monthly, and quarterly reports.
Engage and collaborate with internal and external stakeholders.
Collect and analyze data to update reports, KPIs, and dashboards.
Manage and maintain contract information for compliance.
Maintain and manage data platforms and data systems.
Ensure compliance with policies and procedures.
Identify and implement process improvements to enhance efficiency.




Qualifications & Skills:

Strong analytical and data management skills.
Ability to work collaboratively across teams.
Proficiency in data systems and reporting tools is essesntial such as Excel, PowerBI, SQL, etc
Attention to detail and organizational skills.
Ability to take ownership of his/ her own remit.
Strong stakeholder management experience is essential.
Experience in data analysis, procurement, or supply chain is preferred.




This is an exciting opportunity to develop data expertise in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Learn About Knok

At knok, we dare to lead and humanise the digital transformation of healthcare. We envision a world where everyone has timely access to quality healthcare through digital technology, creating a more equal society. We genuinely believe in it and you can recognise it in every person who embraces this mission.

Through a Digital Front Door strategy, knok connects patients, providers and healthcare professionals in one place. Our API-first white-label platform enables a continuous, engaging and personalised healthcare experience for all conditions through a cutting-edge Patient Journey Engine.

With regular clinical practice as our main source of knowledge, we leverage ready-to-use data to improve care automation and increase financial savings. Since 2015, we have enabled more than 2.5 million clinical interactions in over 12 countries. Our platform is scalable and AI-ready, enhancing the power of data-driven care to deliver better outcomes during all stages of life.

Are you ready to join us in revolutionising healthcare and making a tangible impact on people's lives?

About The Role

We are looking for a Junior Data Analyst to gather, analyse, and interpret business data from multiple sources to extract meaningful insights that drive business decisions. You will play a crucial role in maintaining and improving data processes, ensuring high data quality, and supporting different teams with analytical insights. If this sounds exciting, keep reading!

As a Junior Data Analyst, you will:


Collect, clean, and analyse data to generate valuable business insights,
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and data visualisations to support strategic decision-making,
Automate recurring reports and data processes to improve efficiency,
Support forecasting activities for different services, ensuring accurate planning and resource allocation,
Ensure data integrity and quality, identifying and resolving inconsistencies or anomalies,
Work closely with cross-functional teams to provide data-driven recommendations,
Optimise and automate the medical hours allocation process to enhance operational efficiency


Here are the skills we're looking for:


Bachelor's degree in Management, Biomedical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, or a related field
1 to 2 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a similar role
Strong Excel skills (data manipulation, advanced formulas, VBA)
Experience with data visualisation tools (e.g., Power BI, Apache Superset, or similar)
Critical thinking and problem-solving mindset to translate data into actionable insights
Storytelling with data - ability to communicate findings clearly to different stakeholders
Strong collaboration and communication skills to work effectively with multidisciplinary teams


Nice to have:


Experience with SQL for querying databases
Familiarity with Apache Superset or similar business intelligence tools
Previous experience in healthcare analytics or the healthcare industry
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Natixis in Portugal is fully integrated in the global organization of Natixis, a French multinational financial services firm specialized in Asset & Wealth Management, Corporate & Investment Banking, Insurance and Payments. A subsidiary of Groupe BPCE, Natixis counts nearly 16.000 employees across 38 countries.

Based in Porto, Natixis Centre of Expertise mission is to transform traditional banking by developing innovative solutions for the bank’s business, operations and work culture worldwide, as a key driver of the company’s culture of agility and innovation. Teams of IT and Banking Support Activities work in an integrated, inclusive and transversal way, supporting all the business lines and country platforms.

Natixis in Portugal is the best combination of a “start-up mindset” with a large, solid structure. Its unique culture gives true meaning to a “beyond banking” personality: to be a real entrepreneur, self-challenging, ever striving to excel and go that extra mile.

Job Description

Team presentation and main goal:

As part of the Finance Direction, you will integrate the Financial Data Integrity department (FDI) which oversees the labelling of financial data for CIB activities of Natixis (balance sheet and off-balance sheet).

You will join a team of 6 people in Porto.

As a Senior Data Analyst, of a major French banking institution with international dimension, you will:


Support Data Management initiatives for Internal & Regulatory framework toward improvement of the quality of reports produced by Natixis CIB.
Participate in the Data monitoring for CIB activities (Financing, Global market, etc.)


You will be in contact with the other teams of FDI, internal Finance partners and Finance IT teams.

Main tasks and goals:

As a Senior Data Analyst, your primary tasks will be:

1- Data Systems and Analytics:


Develop solutions for data extraction, exploration, and transformation using SQL and other technologies.
Interface between business line and IT to translate business requirements into data sources and queries, supporting the creation of KPI metrics for dashboards.
Design and implement data architectures, along with new dashboards, to enhance business intelligence capabilities.
Manage and improve the use of data visualization tools like Power BI, ensuring the effective presentation of data to stakeholders;.
Own the creation and maintenance of scheduled reporting, including Power BI dashboards, to regularly inform business decisions.


2- Requirements and Coordination:


Oversee the full lifecycle of business requirements, from elicitation and analysis to documentation, management, and solution translation.
Plan and conduct workshops, interviews, and prototyping sessions to collect, clarify, and confirm business requirements.
Coordinate with Finance IT to monitor and prioritize the remediation plans and overall business requirements.
Ensure the effective coordination and implementation of financial issues remediation with relevant committees and IT teams.


3- Data Governance and Strategy (Technical View & Impact):


Participate in the coordination of the Data Domain Office (DDO) network for finance, including involvement in framework committees and data quality frameworks for projects regarding all technical requests.
Contribute to the strategic planning of Data Management roadmap, aiming to align data management practices with business objectives regarding the technical impact.


4- Monitoring and Collaboration:


Monitor the implementation of business requirements and data strategies in collaboration with IT teams.
Support the management and enhancement of data visualization and BI solutions, fostering a culture of data-driven decision making.
Collaborate with various teams to promote cross-functional unity and ensure the seamless integration of technical data insights into business processes.


Additional information:

You will be part of a bi-localized team with a local manager and a functional manager based in Paris, with regular interactions with the Paris team.

The ability to develop a network within the various teams of the Natixis ecosystem, and an aptitude for collaborative and group work are key factors of success in this position.

Qualifications

Qualifications:


Master’s degree in Finance, Math, Data Analytics, Data Science or Data Engineering;
Understanding of Data Governance and Data Management;
Knowledge in BCBS239 and the respective Streams;
Experienced with Finance / Banking Data (Banking environment, regulations, and products)
Advance expertise in Power BI and Tableau is essential, building automated reports and creating data-driven dashboards;
Knowledge of data transformation and analysis tools (Power Query, DAX, Excel, SQL and Python)
Synthesize complex datasets into clear, efficient, fast, useful, and appealing visualizations, dashboards and reports;
Knowledge in Big Data environments and technical tools for data analysis;
Experience with Atlassian Jira (as a plus);
Experience with Power BI Report Builder, Power Automate, and Power Apps (as a plus);
English (mandatory) and French (as a plus).


Soft Skills:


Strong communication and relationship-building skills;
Analytical mindset with problem-solving capabilities and attention to details;
Understand Business requirement and suggest right architecture;
Curious, proactive, and able to work in a fast-paced environment;
Teamwork orientation and coaching skills to foster a collaborative atmosphere.


Only CV´s in English will be considered.

Additional Information

Early morning. Campo 24 de Agosto. In 4 minutes, you are clocking in at the office. After grabbing a cup of coffee and fresh fruit, pick up your laptop and choose your spot for the day. It's going to be a busy one: French class before lunch and, just after, quick medical appointment at Natixis doctor's office. Lunch break. Outside in the big terrace (look at your crops at the Urban Garden; ready to harvest!) or, if you feel like stretching your legs, walk downtown to grab lunch.

Back inside. Quick sprint review (working together anywhere means virtual happy birthday to that colleague in Paris that just turned 35). The afternoon went flying (tasks, reports, calls, some jokes with your teammates). End it on a high note: just one PlayStation game or the final match for that ping-pong tournament.

Tomorrow, you complete that certified technical training and the day after, you will work from home, taking advantage to finally do that online course on Udemy. Once you are done with your tasks for the day, you can visit the office for a board games session or show up at the rehearsal of one of Natixis bands. If that is too steady for you, meet your colleagues to surf some waves or join them in a football match.
Show more

  • Synthesize complex datasets into clear, efficient, fast, useful, and appealing visualizations, dashboards and reports;
  • Knowledge in Big Data environments and technical tools for data analysis;
  • Experience with Atlassian Jira (as a plus);
  • Experience with Power BI Report Builder, Power Automate, and Power Apps (as a plus);
  • English (mandatory) and French (as a plus).

Soft Skills:

  • Strong communication and relationship-building skills;
  • Analytical mindset with problem-solving capabilities and attention to details;
  • Understand Business requirement and suggest right architecture;
  • Curious, proactive, and able to work in a fast-paced environment;
  • Teamwork orientation and coaching skills to foster a collaborative atmosphere.

Only CV´s in English will be considered.

Additional Information

Early morning. Campo 24 de Agosto. In 4 minutes, you are clocking in at the office. After grabbing a cup of coffee and fresh fruit, pick up your laptop and choose your spot for the day. It's going to be a busy one: French class before lunch and, just after, quick medical appointment at Natixis doctor's office. Lunch break. Outside in the big terrace (look at your crops at the Urban Garden; ready to harvest!) or, if you feel like stretching your legs, walk downtown to grab lunch.

Back inside. Quick sprint review (working together anywhere means virtual happy birthday to that colleague in Paris that just turned 35). The afternoon went flying (tasks, reports, calls, some jokes with your teammates). End it on a high note: just one PlayStation game or the final match for that ping-pong tournament.

Tomorrow, you complete that certified technical training and the day after, you will work from home, taking advantage to finally do that online course on Udemy. Once you are done with your tasks for the day, you can visit the office for a board games session or show up at the rehearsal of one of Natixis bands. If that is too steady for you, meet your colleagues to surf some waves or join them in a football match.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Brillio

Brillio LLC is a fast-growing, pure-play Digital Transformation Solutions and Services company backed by Bain Capital private equity. Founded in 2014 and headquartered in Silicon Valley, Brillio is focused on delivering design-led solutions for our customers. We are not an IT Services company trying to pivot and support the “next big thing.” As a digitally native company, everything we have done and will continue to do, will have this laser focus. Brillio delivers disruptive digital solutions across capabilities such as Design Thinking, Product Engineering, Data Analytics, Digital Front Office, and Digital Infrastructure. Our core values of Customer success, We Care, Entrepreneurial (mind set) and Excellence - drive everything that we do, from the very first day.




Brillio Romania

Brillio Romania is a dynamic and rapidly growing company with over 190 employees and offices in Cluj, Oradea, and Bucharest. With its fast-paced growth, the company has consistently demonstrated an unwavering commitment to client satisfaction.

At Brillio Romania, we know our success comes from the innovative contributions and brilliant work of our people. So, we make fostering a positive work environment our top priority. Employees at Brillio Romania not only thrive, but they also have the chance to build long and fulfilling careers, fostering a sense of stability and dedication that ultimately benefits both the company and our valued clients.




Role Overview

We are seeking a Data Analyst to support the development and evaluation of ML-driven pricing and personalization solutions. This role involves conducting data analysis, designing experiments, and providing insights to enhance machine learning models. The Data Analyst will collaborate with ML Scientists, Data Engineers, and Product Managers to drive data-driven experimentation and decision-making. The ideal candidate has a strong background in statistical analysis, experiment design, and data science workflows. This position requires working hours that overlap with the US Pacific Time (PST), specifically from 14:00 to 22:00 Romania time.




Key Responsibilities

Conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA), hypothesis testing, and statistical modelling to support ML and business objectives
Develop dashboards and visualizations using Tableau, Power BI, Matplotlib, or Seaborn to track key metrics, experiment outcomes, and model performance
Perform deep-dive analyses on specific datasets or business problems, providing actionable insights for strategic decision-making
Design, execute, and interpret A/B tests, multivariate experiments, and other controlled tests to evaluate the effectiveness of ML models
Work closely with ML Scientists, Data Engineers, and Product Managers to align on experiment goals and implement data-driven solutions




Requirements

Availability to work US hours, with an overlap in Pacific Time (PST) from 14:00 to 22:00 Romania time
3 to 4 years of experience in data analysis, experimentation analysis, or a related role supporting ML projects
Strong understanding of statistical methods, hypothesis testing, causal inference, and experiment design
Proficiency in Python for data manipulation, with experience using Pandas, NumPy, and scikit-learn
Ability to write complex SQL queries including Window Functions, Joins, and Group By operations
Familiarity with ML techniques like Classification, Regression, and Clustering
Hands-on experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Matplotlib, or Seaborn
Experience designing and analyzing A/B tests and multivariate experiments to draw actionable insights
Experience working with large, complex datasets, including preprocessing and feature engineering




Nice to Have

Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure for handling large datasets
Familiarity with automated experimentation frameworks
Experience with causal inference techniques to drive data-driven decisions
Understanding of pricing strategies and personalization models in an ML context




Benefits

Fixed benefits:

Flexible working hours and a hybrid model.
We value your time and lifestyle preferences, so you can choose whether you want to work entirely remotely or from our offices in Cluj-Napoca, Oradea, and Bucharest.
Sports benefit
We encourage you to have a healthy lifestyle. We'll reimburse you a maximum of 150 lei/month from your favourite sporting activity: whether it's football, climbing, gym or other sports.
Private health insurance is provided by Signal Iduna.
Birthday gifts
Gift for new-born baby
Development and learning programs in accordance with your job description.
A monthly budget you can use to purchase flexible benefits through the Benefit platform.
Vacation vouchers for tourism in Romania reimbursed up to (max. RON 18.000/year)
Meal tickets
Private pension
Culture vouchers (for festivals, theatres, cinemas, bookshops etc.)
Courses and certifications according to your wishes (driving school, accounting, IT, foreign languages, etc.)
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (PowerBI)
Description:
Who are we:

Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.

We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.

With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.




Neotalent, the responsive people.




Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.




Role Overview:

We are looking for a Data Analyst (PowerBI) to join one of our biggest clients in the Porto area (Hybrid). A multinational financial services firm, one of the largest financial groups and among the 30 largest financial institution’s globally.




What you will do:

Create and update PowerBI Dashboards
Collect data (internal & external) and investigate their business value through data analysis and visualization
Create and adapt data analysis models and tools
Mount, execute and automate ETL processes for extracting data (with python and SQL) to serve analytical needs
Develop & improve data quality controls and standardize processes and analyses
Use previous experience in marketing topics to translate business needs
Collect and visualize KPIs on the performance of our in-house models
Basic knowledge of data python packages




What you are like:

At least 4 years of experience as a Data Analyst;
Experience with PowerBI;
Strong understanding of Agile methodologies and frameworks, particularly Scrum;
Excellent communication skills - English;




Why join us

Work on challenging projects for big clients
Learn more about emerging technologies
Possibility of working remotely
Design your career plan
Access to continuous training and certifications
Evolve through our internal mobility program
… and much more!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data & AI Analyst - Data Management - Azure - Power BI - SQL




Responsibilities

Proactively oversee and coordinate complex data from multiple sources, supporting and enhancing our core professional services.
Collaborate with data architects and engineers to establish efficient data interfaces, ensure smooth data integration, and organize data into a unified schema.
Partner with data domain owners to maintain data integrity and ensure alignment with business goals, driving value creation for both clients and employees.
Assist data stewards by providing frameworks and tools that help maintain high data quality standards.
Analyse and prepare data for internal reporting and client-facing purposes.
Lead the successful integration of AI across the clients core services.
Contribute to embedding AI models into existing systems and workflows.
Ensure smooth deployment of AI solutions and monitor their performance.




Key skills and Knowledge

2+ years of work experience managing data in a highly regulated environment setting
A bachelor's or master's degree in a field with a high exposure to data analytics, such as computer science, applied mathematics, or another
proficiency with programming languages such as Python, R, and SQL
Proficiency in Microsoft Azure AI/ML tools
A solid grasp and admiration of data management frameworks
BI tools like Tableau, Power BI (the preferable option), etc.
Proficiency in Power Query/Pivot, SQL, and Excel macros

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About InstaShop

InstaShop, headquartered in Dubai, is the leading online local marketplace in the UAE and Egypt Since joining the Delivery Hero family in 2020, the global leader in online food delivery and q-commerce, InstaShop has been setting the standard for excellence and convenience in the region.

With a dynamic and motivated team fueled by passion and innovation, every day at InstaShop is an opportunity for growth and success. We champion inclusivity, diversity and collaboration, creating an environment where everyone’s achievements are celebrated and where success is the only way forward. As we continue to grow, our team keeps expanding across the UAE, Egypt and Greece, and we’re always on the lookout for new talents to join us on our success journey. 🌟




About the role

As a Data Analyst at InstaShop, you will be at the forefront of a rapidly evolving industry, responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting data to support decision-making, and drive improvements within a hyper-local on-demand ecosystem. Your role involves collaborating with various teams, including operations, marketing, product development, and technology, to ensure seamless delivery experiences for customers and efficient operations for the company.




Day-to-Day Responsibilities

Data analysis: Collect, clean, and analyze large data sets related, but not limited to, customer orders, delivery times, stock, operational metrics to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement by continuously providing feedback
Data Collection: Work with a large set of diverse sources, ensuring accuracy and consistency.
Reporting: Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and data visualizations to provide real-time insights and performance metrics to stakeholders
Requirements gathering: Partner with teams across departments to elicit, document, and prioritize business requirements for technology and product development




Key Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Business, Economics, or a related field
Minimum 2+ years experience in data analysis and business analysis, preferably in the e-commerce, on-demand delivery, or logistics industries
Proven experience in data analysis and business analysis, preferably in the e-commerce, on-demand delivery, or logistics industries
Proven experience in performing statistical analysis to uncover trends, patterns, and insights
Proficiency in data analysis and data visualization tools
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to translate data into actionable insights and knowledge
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams
Detail-oriented and highly organized with a commitment to data accuracy
Familiarity with agile methodologies and project management concepts
Knowledge of supply chain management, logistics, and delivery operations is a plus
Understanding of digital marketing principles and online advertising is a plus




What you will bring

SQL Proficiency: Writing complex queries for data retrieval and exposure to database systems (e.g. MySQL, PostgreSQL, Apache Druid)
Python scripting for Data Analysis (e.g. Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib/Seaborn)
Data Visualization skills (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, Looker)




Nice to have, but not required

Exposure to Data Warehouse solutions (e.g. BigQuery, RedShift)
Exposure to No SQL databases such as Mongo DB
Exposure to Excel or Google Sheets
Exposure to Amazon Web Services
Exposure to Distributed SQL query engines (e.g. Trino)

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description:

Are you a data enthusiast with a knack for transforming raw data into actionable insights? Do you love solving complex problems and helping businesses make smarter decisions? If so, we're looking for you!




Responsibilities:

Collect data through interviews, surveys, web search, database search, or other methods.
Partner with various teams to identify key information gaps and plan to provide that information.
Synthesize and analyze information from various sources to identify trends, opportunities, and dangers.




Requirements:

2+ years of data analytics and business analysis experience
Solid experience building and maintaining dashboards, specifically Tableau.
Working knowledge of DB environments like snowflake and SQL are a plus
Ability to work with a varied community to understand requirements; the ability to "ask the right questions"; a focus on results with strong prioritization skills




About us:

Ascendion is a Global, leading provider of AI-first software engineering services, delivering transformative solutions across North America, APAC, and Europe. We are headquartered in New Jersey.




We combine technology and talent to deliver tech debt relief, improve engineering productivity solutions, and accelerate time to value, driving our clients’ digital journeys with efficiency and velocity. Guided by our “Engineering to the power of AI” [EngineeringAI] methodology, we integrate AI into software engineering, enterprise operations, and talent orchestration, to address critical challenges of trust, speed, and capital.

Title: Analista dati
Description:
Posizione: Analista Dati - GLS Corriere Espresso




Sede di lavoro: Catania, Sicilia




Chi siamo:

GLS Corriere Espresso è una delle principali aziende nel settore della logistica e delle spedizioni. Siamo alla ricerca di un analista dati che supporti l'ottimizzazione dei processi aziendali attraverso l'analisi avanzata dei dati.




Responsabilità:

Analizzare e monitorare i dati relativi ai flussi logistici, alle spedizioni e alle performance dei nostri servizi.
Creare report e dashboard per supportare il monitoraggio delle attività quotidiane e l'ottimizzazione dei processi.
Identificare tendenze e comportamenti nei dati per migliorare l'efficienza operativa e ridurre i costi.
Collaborare con i team operativi e manageriali per tradurre i dati in strategie aziendali concrete.
Gestire la qualità dei dati, garantendo che siano precisi, coerenti e tempestivi.
Utilizzare strumenti di analisi avanzata per prevedere e migliorare la qualità del servizio.




Requisiti:

Laurea in Statistica, Ingegneria, Informatica o discipline affini.
Preferibile esperienza minima in un ruolo simile.
Ottima conoscenza di Excel e di software di Business Intelligence (Power BI).
Forte capacità analitica e problem solving, con attenzione ai dettagli.
Ottime capacità comunicative per presentare i risultati in modo chiaro e comprensibile.
Attitudine al lavoro in team e orientamento agli obiettivi.




Cosa offriamo:

Opportunità di formazione e aggiornamento continuo su nuove tecnologie e strumenti.
Inquadramento a norma di legge in base all’esperienza pregressa.







La ricerca è per entrambi i sessi (L. 903/77).

Titolare del trattamento dei dati personali: Mediterranea Express, sede legale in Via Arsenale n.44 / G, 96100 Siracusa.

I dati personali saranno trattati ai soli fini della selezione richiesta dal candidato.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us:

LTIMindtree is a global technology consulting and digital solutions company that enables enterprises across industries to reimagine business models, accelerate innovation, and maximize growth by harnessing digital technologies. As a digital transformation partner to more than 700+ clients, LTIMindtree brings extensive domain and technology expertise to help drive superior competitive differentiation, customer experiences, and business outcomes in a converging world. Powered by nearly 90,000 talented and entrepreneurial professionals across more than 30 countries, LTIMindtree — a Larsen & Toubro Group company — combines the industry-acclaimed strengths of erstwhile Larsen and Toubro Infotech and Mindtree in solving the most complex business challenges and delivering transformation at scale. For more information, please visit www.ltimindtree.com.




We are hiring Data Analyst in Stockholm, Sweden with below expertise:




Minimum 8 10 years of IT experience and minimum 3 4 years of Analyst experience overall 5 years of Data Analyst experience
Advanced Business Analyst who has profound experience in doing data Analysis using SQL Knowing SAS Python is an added advantage
Well versed and comfortable in handling Huge Datasets
Good Analytical and problem-solving skills

Good Analytical and problem solving skills
Added advantage in creating functional test cases and validating the results
It is very important to have good communication skills and an agile team player




Mandatory Skills : MS Excel, PowerBI, Python, QlikView, Tableau

Good to Have Skills : ANSI-SQL

For more information, please visit www.ltimindtree.com.

Title: Data Analyst - Insights / Performance / Quality €100k
Description:
Role: Data Analyst
Salary Range: €100K - €110k
Contract Length: 11- months - PAYE - paid weekly
Location: Dublin, remote/ hybrid (must already be based here in Ireland, no sponsorship available)




*********** Candidates must hold appropriate work visa, no sponsorships/work permits provided, and you cannot work from abroad **************




As a Data Analyst, you will be working within the Quality Analytics and Insights team which sits in org's Operations team.




What you’ll do:

Perform deep-dive statistical analysis to uncover trends and insights
Build compelling dashboards in Tableau to drive key decisions
Partner with teams across Legal, Compliance, Insights, and Systems
Translate complex data into clear, actionable business insights




What we’re looking for:

5+ years of experience working as a Data Analyst within a Consulting or Tech Background
SQL expertise – you can write clean, efficient queries
Tableau mastery – you know how to build dashboards that tell a story
Strong stakeholder management – you can make data accessible to all
Good knowledge/ experience in statistical analysis of data using techniques like regression, hypothesis testing, and time series analysis to identify trends, patterns, and correlations.
Excellent communication skills.




Next Steps...




Apply Now for this Data Analyst role or similar opportunities with your CV or LinkedIn profile or just your contact details.




All applications are reviewed by me Som in Principle. Som | som@principlehr.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job title : Data Analyst

Job type : CDI Contracts / Freelancers

Location: Brussels

Work Regime: Hybrid

Keywords: Data analysis/Data Collection/Data Preparation/

Sector: our client is a leading company in the energy sector, renowned for its expertise in transmission and distribution networks. It plays a vital role in ensuring the reliability and efficiency of electricity supply across regions. With a commitment to innovation and sustainability, this company invests in cutting-edge technologies to optimize grid operations and integrate renewable energy sources.

Project Overview

This role involves establishing multi-energy scenarios through interactions with experts and public workshops, culminating in a public consultation. The Data Analyst will assist in creating scenarios, engaging with stakeholders, and performing various tasks within the SMA (Scenario, Market & Adequacy) team.




Key Skills

Energy Sector Knowledge: Understanding of the energy market and awareness of the latest developments and trends within Belgium and abroad.
Data Collection and Analysis: Ability to collect, understand, and prepare inputs for scenario creation.
Visualization: Proficiency in visualizing scenario assumptions and presenting them to stakeholders.
Documentation: Experience in preparing documents (Excel, Word) for public consultation and taking minutes during workshops.
Feedback Collection: Ability to collect feedback from experts and respond to comments during public consultations.
MS Office Proficiency: Good knowledge of MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).
Graph Creation: Ability to create graphs that make complex data easy to understand.
Programming Knowledge: Knowledge of Python/R/economic dispatch tools/VBA/data handling is a plus.
Organization and Attention to Detail: Well-organized with strong attention to detail.
Proactive: Proactive attitude towards work.




Roles and Responsibilities

Scenario Creation: Assist in creating multi-energy scenarios through collaboration with experts and public workshops.
Stakeholder Engagement: Engage with stakeholders, including other transmission system operators (Fluxys, DSO’s), and participate in the intensive stakeholder interaction process.
Data Collection and Preparation: Collect, understand, and prepare inputs for scenario creation, including NECP, latest trends, development plans of other major players, and decarbonization plans of the industry.
Visualization and Presentation: Visualize scenario assumptions and present them to stakeholders through workshops.
Documentation and Minutes: Prepare documents for public consultation and take minutes during workshops.




A little about us:

Innova Solutions is a diverse and award-winning global technology services partner. We provide our clients with strategic technology, talent, and business transformation solutions, enabling them to be leaders in their field.

in 1998, headquartered in Atlanta (Duluth), Georgia.
over 50,000 professionals worldwide, with annual revenue approaching $3.0B.
strategic technology and business transformation solutions globally.
through global delivery centers across North America, Asia, and Europe.
services for data center migration and workload development for cloud service providers.

Awardee of prestigious recognitions including:

Choice Awards - Best Companies to Work for Women & Millennials, 2024
America’s Best Temporary Staffing and Best Professional Recruiting Firms, 2023
Best in Business, Globee Awards, Healthcare Vulnerability Technology Solutions, 2023
Health & Pharma, Best Full Service Workforce Lifecycle Management Enterprise, 2023
3 SBU Leadership in Business Awards
International Business Awards, Denials Remediation Healthcare Technology Solutions, 2023

Title: Analista de datos comerciales
Description:
En Plenitude nos gustaría incorporar un Web Data Analyst para dar apoyo al departamento de Digital & Communication en nuestras oficinas en Madrid, España. Reportando directamente al manager de Digital & Communication, la persona seleccionada se encargará principalmente de definir una estrategia de datos y una consecuente implementación de sistemas de seguimiento, con una visión completa de todo el ciclo de los datos, así como de interactuar con figuras del área de negocios y IT para encontrar la mejor solución en términos de eficiencia y precisión.

Acerca de Plenitude:

Plenitude es una empresa benefit de energía que integra el negocio minorista y generación de renovables junto a soluciones de autoconsumo y movilidad eléctrica, proporcionando energía eléctrica y gas a más de 10 millones de hogares y empresas en toda Europa, lo que ofrece un abanico de grandes oportunidades profesionales para todo el equipo.

Esta adhesión supone un gran proyecto europeo integrando el negocio de las renovables con el negocio minorista, lo que nos permitirá aumentar progresivamente nuestra oferta de servicios, infraestructuras y energía verde para nuestros clientes, proporcionando a nuestro equipo una mayor proyección y crecimiento profesional.

Como parte del departamento Digital & Communication, serás responsable de:

Apoyar a las figuras de negocio (PO, digital marketing manager, acquisition manager, media manager) en la definición de una estrategia de seguimiento efectiva, mediante la compartición de guías y requisitos con TI.
Verificar constantemente la consistencia de las soluciones de seguimiento compartidas, contribuyendo a la definición de un marco estable.
Monitorear el rendimiento de los principales activos digitales (portal web, app, landing pages, redes sociales) con un enfoque en Google Analytics.
Apoyar los análisis de negocio mediante informes y dashboards en Google Data Studio y otras herramientas de visualización de datos.
Gestionar el data layer y los seguimientos a través de Google Tag Manager.
Analizar el comportamiento del usuario para obtener insights útiles que mejoren la experiencia del usuario y aumenten las adquisiciones/generación de leads.
Sugerir estrategias para mejorar el rendimiento del sitio mediante soluciones de seguimiento/debugging y optimización de píxeles/cookies.
Poseer un conocimiento avanzado de los actores de la publicidad digital, de la Google Marketing Platform, y contar con experiencia comprobada en la creación de dashboards de medios, conciliando datos de diferentes fuentes.
Redactar documentos de data-viz de análisis de comportamiento y de negocio.

Esta es tu oportunidad si tienes estas aptitudes y requisitos:

Conocimiento de tecnologías web como Javascript/Ajax/Jquery, HTML, aplicaciones de página única (SPA).
Conocimiento de HTTP, HTTPS y del protocolo cliente/servidor, gestión de cookies e implementación de centros de cookies.
Conocimiento avanzado de Google Analytics, Data Studio, BigQuery y Google Tag Manager.
Idiomas: fluidez en inglés y español; el italiano es un plus.
Experiencia trabajando en entornos multinacionales
Probada experiencia En el sector.
Conocimientos en herramientas de pruebas A/B/multivariadas y competencias en diseño de pruebas/medición para la optimización de tasas de conversión.
Conocimientos del gestor de etiquetas Commanders Act.
Herramientas de medición SEO y de audiencia: Semrush, Similar Web, Statista y similares.
Comprensión de la dinámica de funcionamiento y/o conocimiento de AngularJS, ReactJS y otros frameworks.
Conocimiento básico de Python y APIs.
Buen conocimiento de los métodos de desarrollo de aplicaciones móviles (lenguajes, nativas/híbridas, web views).
Experiencia en eCommerce, retail digital (seguros, telecomunicaciones, banca, etc.)
Conocimiento del sector de energía es un plus.
Capacidad analíticas y competencias en todo el stack de GA 360 – GA4, con excelentes habilidades de comunicación y familiarizado con construcción y medición de embudos de medios, modelos de datos y métricas de optimización de conversiones.
¡Fuerte pasión por los datos, la tecnología de marketing, las tecnologías en general y el mundo de la experiencia del usuario!

Localización:

Madrid, España

Typo de Contrato:

Permanente

Show more

  • Conocimientos del gestor de etiquetas Commanders Act.
  • Herramientas de medición SEO y de audiencia: Semrush, Similar Web, Statista y similares.
  • Comprensión de la dinámica de funcionamiento y/o conocimiento de AngularJS, ReactJS y otros frameworks.
  • Conocimiento básico de Python y APIs.
  • Buen conocimiento de los métodos de desarrollo de aplicaciones móviles (lenguajes, nativas/híbridas, web views).
  • Experiencia en eCommerce, retail digital (seguros, telecomunicaciones, banca, etc.)
  • Conocimiento del sector de energía es un plus.
  • Capacidad analíticas y competencias en todo el stack de GA 360 – GA4, con excelentes habilidades de comunicación y familiarizado con construcción y medición de embudos de medios, modelos de datos y métricas de optimización de conversiones.
  • ¡Fuerte pasión por los datos, la tecnología de marketing, las tecnologías en general y el mundo de la experiencia del usuario!

Localización:

Madrid, España

Typo de Contrato:

Permanente

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
L’Open Banking è il nostro DNA!




Centrico ha le sue radici nelle rivoluzioni tecnologiche guidate dal gruppo Sella e dal 2019 è una realtà indipendente: creiamo innovazione per il mondo delle banche e della finanza con un sistema informativo aperto, veloce, modulabile e conveniente.




Il nostro obiettivo è diventare una data driven company!

Per vincere questa sfida, la persona che cerchiamo farà parte dell’area Data Management di Centrico in qualità di Data Analyst e si occuperà di analizzare i dati per fornire insights utili a supporto dei processi decisionali interni al Gruppo.




Responsabilità:

Analizzerai grandi quantità di dati per identificare trend, pattern e insights utili
Creerai report e dashboard per visualizzare i dati in modo chiaro e comprensibile
Collaborerai con team multidisciplinari (Business, IT, Compliance, Risk) per comprendere le esigenze di analisi dei dati e fornire soluzioni data-driven
Supporterai l’individuazione di regole e di livelli di controllo dell'accesso ai dati
Contribuirai al miglioramento continuo della piattaforma dati del Gruppo tramite l’implementazione di best practice e standard di settore




Requisiti:

Esperienza di almeno 4 anni nel medesimo ruolo o in ruolo affine
Laurea in discipline STEM
Conoscenza avanzata di strumenti di analisi dati (es. SQL, Python, R)
Buona conoscenza di strumenti di visualizzazione dati (es. Power BI, Tableau)
Ottime capacità relazionali sia verso interlocutori tecnici sia di business
Spiccate capacità analitiche e di problem solving




Nice to have:

Esperienza con tecnologie di big data (es. Hadoop, Spark)
Conoscenza di tecniche di machine learning e data mining
Esperienza con strumenti di ETL (es. Talend, Informatica)
Certificazioni professionali in ambito data analysis (es. Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate)
Conoscenza di metodologie Agile e Scrum




Cosa offriamo:

Un ambiente positivo e in cui il tuo contributo venga apprezzato, la tua opinione è importante e vogliamo che tu la esprima
Piattaforma e-learning Microsoft: per non smettere mai di imparare e di certificarti
Attività di engagement (tornei di Beach Volley, Padel, Calcetto) e di volontariato aziendale
Contratto con CCNL del Credito
Cura della persona anche con la polizza sanitaria - per te e il tuo nucleo familiare - e polizza TCM
Supporto al benessere psicologico attraverso Stimulus, uno sportello esterno di ascolto a disposizione dei colleghi e dei loro famigliari
Uno sguardo al tuo futuro attraverso il contributo aziendale al fondo pensione
Policy di lavoro flessibile




Sede di lavoro: Milano o Torino o Biella con modalità ibrida.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst F/H
Description:
Missions :

Au sein du Groupe Altice, vous intégrerez la Direction Exécutive Opérations et particulièrement la Direction de la Relation client B2B. Le B2B est au service la digitalisation des entreprises et opérateurs.




Sa mission : gagner de nouveaux marchés en proposant des offres fixe et mobile en très haut débit et des offres de services dédiées (Cloud, sécurité, internet des objets, CRM).




Au sein de la Direction Expérience Client dans l'équipe Efficacité Opérationnelle de SFR Business, vous intégrez une équipe ayant pour missions :

D'établir un recueil des besoins / cadrage d'une demande
D'identifier les données à collecter, les nettoyer, les traiter et les stocker
D'ordonnancer l'alimentation de ces données
d'être garant de la fiabilité et de la pertinence des données
d'évaluer et choisir les méthodes statistiques à utiliser
D'analyser les données, les mettre en forme et procéder aux recommandations / préconisations, vulgariser les données pour les rendre accessibles
D'optimiser et rationaliser les reportings existants
De documenter les données
De participer aux missions transverses de l'équipe




Profil :

De formation Bac +5 en informatique et statistiques ou équivalent, ou de type master spécialisé en statistiques ou en data, diplômé d'une grande école spécialisée dans la statistique.




Doté(e) d'une passion pour les chiffres et d'une aisance relationnelle, vous êtes rigoureux(se), agile, et force de proposition. Autonome dans la gestion de vos tâches, vous êtes capable de mener de front plusieurs sujets pour optimiser votre temps (humain/machine).




Vous disposez d'une capacité d'analyse / prise de recul / de communication, de synthèse et de priorisation.

Connaissances techniques requises :

Maîtrise des bases de données
Programmation / Requêtage : R, SAS, SQL, Python (Business Object)
Outil d'ordonnancement : Expert AIRFLOW (ETL)
Datavisualisation : TABLEAU
Atout supplémentaire : connaissances Salesforce / Machine Learning
Show more

  • d'être garant de la fiabilité et de la pertinence des données
  • d'évaluer et choisir les méthodes statistiques à utiliser
  • D'analyser les données, les mettre en forme et procéder aux recommandations / préconisations, vulgariser les données pour les rendre accessibles
  • D'optimiser et rationaliser les reportings existants
  • De documenter les données
  • De participer aux missions transverses de l'équipe


Profil :

De formation Bac +5 en informatique et statistiques ou équivalent, ou de type master spécialisé en statistiques ou en data, diplômé d'une grande école spécialisée dans la statistique.


Doté(e) d'une passion pour les chiffres et d'une aisance relationnelle, vous êtes rigoureux(se), agile, et force de proposition. Autonome dans la gestion de vos tâches, vous êtes capable de mener de front plusieurs sujets pour optimiser votre temps (humain/machine).


Vous disposez d'une capacité d'analyse / prise de recul / de communication, de synthèse et de priorisation.

Connaissances techniques requises :

  • Maîtrise des bases de données
  • Programmation / Requêtage : R, SAS, SQL, Python (Business Object)
  • Outil d'ordonnancement : Expert AIRFLOW (ETL)
  • Datavisualisation : TABLEAU
  • Atout supplémentaire : connaissances Salesforce / Machine Learning

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Emma Villas, tour operator italiano leader a livello internazionale nel settore degli affitti turistici di ville e casali in Italia, cerca un candidato da inquadrare come Process and Data Analyst, da inserire all’interno dell’organico aziendale.




Il candidato dovrà occuparsi di:




- Analizzare grandi volumi di dati per identificare tendenze, modelli e opportunità.

- Creare report e dashboard che forniscano informazioni chiare e utili.

- Collaborare con diversi dipartimenti per supportare le decisioni basate sui dati.

- Migliorare i processi di raccolta e analisi dei dati.

- Analizzare ed aggregare dati al fine dello studio di un determinato prodotto o segmento di mercato e consentire all’azienda di sviluppare e/o migliorare i propri modelli di business in modo prospettico.

- Presentare i risultati delle analisi a diverse audience, rendendo le informazioni accessibili e comprensibili.

I requisiti richiesti sono:

- Laurea in Statistica, Informatica, Economia, Matematica, Economia, Ingegneria Gestionaleo campo correlato.

- Esperienza pregressa come Data Analyst o in una posizione simile.

- Conoscenza avanzata di Excel e strumenti di analisi dati (es. Access, SQL, Python, R).

- Capacità di visualizzazione dei dati con strumenti come Tableau o Power BI.

- Eccellenti capacità di problem-solving e pensiero critico.

- Ottime capacità di comunicazione scritta e verbale.

- Conoscenza della lingua inglese.




Sede di lavoro: Chiusi (Si)

Orario: full time

Disponibilità: da subito




Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91 e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03.

Title: Analista de Datos – Investigación y Causa-Raíz (Senior)
Description:
✨¿Quieres ser protagonista de soluciones que impacten a nivel global? ¡Forma parte del cambio!




💚 Somos Softtek, un grupo tecnológico global que integra una cultura única, beneficios y un gran desarrollo, tanto profesional como humano, con presencia en más de 20 países y 14 sedes en España. Generamos valor a través de la tecnología y nuestro objetivo es dejar huella y trascender en el ámbito de la transformación digital. Ya sumamos más 16.000 softtekians alrededor del mundo y seguimos creciendo.




En 2024 hemos sido reconocidos por la Lista Forbes como una de las 100 mejores empresas para trabajar en España, destacando por la flexibilidad y la personalización de la experiencia del empleado. Creemos que las personas con talento y autodeterminación son capaces de crear cosas asombrosas. ¿Nos acompañas en esta aventura? #FutureTogether




🔎¿Qué buscamos?




Buscamos un Analista de Datos con al menos 5 años de experiencia con una mentalidad analítica y resolutiva para ayudar a nuestro equipo a detectar desviaciones en KPIs y generar reportes estratégicos. Buscamos a una persona con habilidades sólidas de análisis y comunicación de datos, capaz de extraer conclusiones relevantes y presentarlas de manera clara.




Tendrás la oportunidad de asumir interesantes desafíos y trabajar con clientes internacionales de gran repercusión, utilizando tecnologías punteras y colaborando en equipos multidisciplinares en los que podrás aprender y aportar todo tu potencial.




Los requisitos más valorables son:




Experiencia con herramientas de visualización de datos (Power BI).
Experiencia valorable en SQL
Conocimientos para identificar patrones, anomalías y causas-raíz de desviaciones en KPIs.
Valorable experiencia trabajando en proyectos QA.
Nivel de inglés (B1-B2)
Presencialidad 3 días en oficinas de cliente. (Pozuelo de Alarcón)




¿Cómo será tu día a día?




Definición de la estrategia de integración y participación del plan de pruebas:
Analizar datos para identificar patrones, anomalías y causas-raíz de desviaciones en KPIs.
Investigar en profundidad diferentes fuentes de datos para obtener conclusiones estratégicas.
Presentar insights claros de manera visual y comprensible para el negocio.




✅¿Qué ofrecemos?




Contrato indefinido.

👪 Posibilidad de teletrabajo, horario flexible y mejoras para favorecer la conciliación a través de nuestro programa BetterWork.

✈️24 días de vacaciones

🩺 Seguro médico

Retribución flexible: tarjeta transporte, tarjeta restaurante, cheque guardería o seguro médico familiares.

🎂 Tarde de cumpleaños libre (también por el cumple de tus hijos)

Club del empleado: ofertas y promociones exclusivas por ser Softtekian.

🎓 Planes de formación: idiomas, tecnologías y soft skills

🌍 Oportunidad de movilidad interna: contamos con presencia internacional y diversas sedes en España




👀 ¿Todavía sigues aquí?

¡Tu incorporación es nuestra prioridad! No dudes en apuntarte, estamos deseando conocerte.

onocerte.




Valoraremos especialmente la candidatura de personas que posean habilidades y capacidades únicas y diversas, reconociendo la importancia de facilitar su integración plena en el mercado laboral. Cada individuo, con sus capacidades singulares, aporta una riqueza invaluable a nuestra comunidad, y nuestro compromiso es asegurar que todos tengan la oportunidad de demostrar su valía y contribuir al crecimiento y la diversidad de nuestro equipo.

Show more

Title: Senior Business Data Analyst
HTML:
Are we the best-kept secret in Málaga?

We like to think so. Over the past year, our Málaga hub has grown into a thriving center of excellence, where we combine innovation, collaboration, and opportunity. We are serious about finding the right people and are confident that we have a lot to offer.


The role in a nutshell

In this position, you will contribute to the accuracy, completeness, and alignment of data across Glencore’s Coupa platform, Boomi middleware, and multiple ERP systems (predominantly SAP). This role focuses on monitoring data across these systems, identifying variances, and ensuring resolutions to maintain synchronization and prevent discrepancies. Imagine transforming data governance by automating reconciliation, uncovering actionable insights, and collaborating with global Coupa and SAP teams to address root causes. Your efforts will ensure timely purchase orders, smooth invoice processing, and optimized procurement and finance functions—having a direct effect on business success worldwide. It’s a strategic opportunity to elevate data governance practices and deliver valuable insights to business units for continuous improvement.


More specifically, you will be expected to:

• Oversee reconciliation processes between Coupa and ERP systems, ensuring data accuracy and completeness;

• Manage automated monitoring of transactional and master data using Power BI to track variances and discrepancies;

• Analyze variances, identify root causes, and develop protocols to resolve and prevent future issues;

• Define and document governance policies for data reconciliation in alignment with audit standards;

• Collaborate with SAP and Coupa support teams to address system variances while maintaining compliance;

• Provide stakeholders with variance reports and actionable insights through Power BI dashboards; • Assist in implementing financial and operational controls to elevate governance practices;

• Develop KPIs to monitor reconciliation performance and identify patterns for improvement;

• Lead automation initiatives to optimize reconciliation processes and reduce manual efforts;

• Conduct data analysis to uncover inefficiencies, recurring issues, and opportunities for optimization.


Do you have what it takes?

• Extensive experience in data reconciliation and ERP systems, particularly SAP;

• Solid analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on operational efficiency;

• Advanced proficiency in Power BI and SQL for data visualization and analysis;

• Skilled in designing and implementing data integrity controls and governance frameworks;

• Deep understanding of cross-system data integration and validation;

• Effective communication skills to engage and influence cross-functional teams;

• Solid understanding of financial and operational controls within large-scale systems;

• Experience with multi-ERP environments and managing ETL processes


Language : As you will be part of a global team, you are expected to communicate fluently in English (verbal and written). Knowledge of other languages such as French, German, or Spanish is favorable but not mandatory.


Travel: Some occasional travelling will be required.


Location: This role will ideally be based at our Malaga office, but we could consider other suitable locations


Wondering what’s in it for you?

🆙 Be part of a world class organization with a mandate to identify opportunities for improvement and drive performance benefits

🏠 Hybrid Work

💰 Competitive compensation structure

👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Health Insurance coverage for you and your dependents

🛟 Life Insurance

📈 Growth Opportunities (career progression, tuition assistance, language courses, training and certifications, etc.)

🛬 Relocation assistance


If you are ready to join our diverse team, make a difference and advance your career in a global setting, we want to hear from you.

Join us and help shape the future of data-driven procurement and finance processes! Given the global nature of the role, we ask applicants to submit their resume in English and indicate their working rights status.

Glencore encourages diversity and provides an inclusive workplace.

Accommodations are available upon request for applicants with special needs.

Interviews may start prior to the closing date.

Title: Data analyst F/H
Description:
About

Pour accompagner la mise en place du processus de planification des ventes et des opérations (Sales&Operation planning, S&OP), l’entité « cohérence stratégique » recherche un data analyst pour piloter et architecturer le référentiel data associé au S&OP et sa gouvernance, préparer les différentes reviews S&OP, suivre les indicateurs associés, et préparer des tableaux de bord de responsabilité « cohérence stratégique ».

En tant que data analyst, vous jouez un rôle clé dans la transformation de MBDA et sa capacité à prendre des décisions éclairées face aux défis géostratégiques actuels. Votre expertise permettra d’accompagner la croissance de l’entreprise et d’optimiser l’utilisation des données, notamment par le choix des outils et bases de données.

L’ Architecture / Gestion Des Données

En interface avec différentes directions (Sales, opérations, ingénierie, finance et IM) et les filiales de MBDA, vous aurez pour principales missions :

Structuration des différentes bases de données nécessaires au S&OP – définition des règles de gestion de structuration des différentes bases de données entre elles.

Gouvernance et architecture des données S&OP

Extraction des données nécessaires à l’analyse

Analyse des données

Définition des règles de gestion de nettoyage des bases de données

Maîtrise de la qualité des données tout au long de leur traitement.

Outil S&OP

Rédaction des besoins outil S&OP, test et recettes

Simulation de scénarios sur la base des données collectées et fiabilisées

Evaluation desdits scénarios

Processus S&OP

Préparation des « demand review », des « supply review » des « S&OP review » et du cascading des décisions prises en S&OP

Suivi des plans d’actions définis en fonction des simulations réalisées

Préparation et automatisation des tableaux de bords permettant notamment la mise en place de plans d’amélioration continue

Veille technologique sur les outils d’analyse de données

Effectuer une veille sur les nouvelles technologies et solutions logicielles d’analyse des données

Rechercher et expérimenter de nouvelles méthodes de modélisation et d’analyse des données

Sélectionner les nouveaux outils et techniques d’analyse des données

De formation Ingénieur ou équivalent, vous disposez d’une première expérience réussie dans le développement de solutions analytiques, dans un contexte industriel.

Vous avez grâce à vos compétences en gestion de projet, développé des compétences en IT, Data Analytique, Statistique qui vous permettent d’être à l’aise dans la construction de KPIs, dans la modélisation de la donnée, et dans l’utilisation des outils de Business Intelligence (Power BI, SAC, Qlikview …).

Vous disposez d’une maitrise des langages VBA et SQL et idéalement d’une connaissance de l’environnement SAP (SAP3, SAP4). Anglais courant souhaité.

Interfacer avec tous niveaux d’interlocuteurs métiers de l’entreprise dans le groupe

Rôle clé lors de présentations destinées notamment au CoDiR

Contexte International

Nice-to-have skills


Data Analytics
Statistics
Data Modeling
Business Intelligence
Power BI
SAP
VBA
SQL
Le Plessis-Robinson, Île-de-France, France


Work experience


Data Analyst


Languages


French

Title: 🚀Data Analyst – Power BI & SQL 🚀
Description:
excelia is a multinational firm specializing in Consulting, Technology, and Professional Services, with over 25 years of experience. We provide services in more than 50 countries across Europe, Latin America, and the United States from our 9 own offices.




Are you passionate about data analysis and process optimization? At excelia, we are looking for a Data Analyst with experience in Power BI and SQL to join our team.




🔹 What will you do in this role?

Develop dashboards, KPIs, and ETL processes in the context of residential customer sales.
Monitor and optimize data processing.
Identify opportunities for improvement in reports, indicators, and processes.
Collaborate with commercial channels, support teams, and other company departments.
Conduct data and business analysis to drive decision-making.




🔹 Technical Requirements:

✔️ Advanced knowledge of SQL and Power BI.

✔️ Ability to work with Python (a plus).




🔹 What are we looking for?

✅ 1 to 3 years of experience in dashboard development, KPIs, and ETL processes.

✅ A degree in Business Intelligence, Data Analytics, or a related field (preferred).

✅ Strong communication and negotiation skills with internal clients and support teams.

✅ Goal-oriented mindset with a focus on meeting deadlines.

✅ Critical thinking and proactivity in identifying improvement opportunities.




📍 Location: Lisbon (Campo Grande)




📩 Interested? Apply now and be part of our team!

Title: Data Governance Analyst (Remoto)
Description:
Kiteris es una empresa joven y ágil dedicada a brindar servicios de gestión de servicios y proyectos TI de integración de software, basados en la entrega de excelencia, la calidad de nuestro equipo y la aportación de valor a través de la especialización y la innovación. Estamos ubicados en España y Portugal, pero trabajamos para diferentes clientes en Europa, USA, y LATAM.




En Kiteris Data, el grupo de Business Intelligence de Kiteris Solutions, estamos buscando una persona para desarrollar la función de Arquitecto de datos o Data Governance.




Nuestro objetivo es comprender los retos del negocio de nuestros clientes y crear aplicaciones analíticas sólidas y escalables para ayudarlos a mejorar su proceso de análisis y toma de decisiones.




Te unirás a un proyecto europeo de alto impacto donde un equipo de expertos en datos con alta visibilidad en el programa que te mentorizarán y acompañarán en tu curva de aprendizaje. Los Data Spaces en Europa representan un esfuerzo coordinado para potenciar el uso y la compartición de datos de forma segura y estructurada, impulsando tanto la innovación tecnológica como la competitividad a nivel europeo.







Principales responsabilidades:




Gestión y trazabilidad de datos, asegurando alineación con los procesos de negocio.
Asesoramiento en gobernanza y calidad del dato, garantizando conformidad con estándares europeos (Gaia-X, IDSA).
Diseño y validación de arquitectura de datos en diferentes entornos del programa.
Estrategias de interoperabilidad y middleware para la integración con Data Spaces europeos.
Identificación y cumplimiento de estándares de seguridad en almacenamiento y manejo de datos (GDPR).
Colaboración en la definición y estandarización de APIs de datos.
Evaluación de riesgos en infraestructura de datos y recomendación de estrategias de mitigación.
Revisión y validación de modelos de datos y ontologías para garantizar interoperabilidad.
Evaluación de escenarios técnicos y arquitectónicos, asegurando su viabilidad.
Coordinación con equipos de desarrollo, arquitectura y QA para asegurar calidad y cumplimiento.
Revisión de documentación técnica y entregables.







Experiencia y actitudes/aptitudes necesarias:

Generales:

Inglés B2 – C1 imprescindible
Permiso de trabajo en España.
Mentalidad analítica.
Trabajo en equipo.
Actitud proactiva y ganas de aprender.




Técnicas:

Experiencia sólida en Gobernanza y Arquitectura de Datos.
Background técnico en proyectos de Data.
Conocimientos en gestión de proyectos y coordinación de equipos.
Capacidad analítica y enfoque crítico para evaluar escenarios técnicos y arquitectónicos.







¿Qué ofrecemos?

Trabajo 100% en remoto.
Flexibilidad horaria.
Contrato indefinido.
Incorporación inmediata.
Revisión salarial continuada.
Plan de carrera profesional en empresa en crecimiento.
La posibilidad de aprender y analizar diferentes modelos de negocio (Empresas de servicios IT, comercialización eléctrica, empresas de consumo, empresas del sector agrícola, empresas del sector industrial...).
Formación continua en tecnología, soft-skills e inglés.
Seguro médico privado cofinanciado.
Ticket restaurante, transporte y guardería.
Show more
HTML:
Kiteris es una empresa joven y ágil dedicada a brindar servicios de gestión de servicios y proyectos TI de integración de software, basados en la entrega de excelencia, la calidad de nuestro equipo y la aportación de valor a través de la especialización y la innovación. Estamos ubicados en España y Portugal, pero trabajamos para diferentes clientes en Europa, USA, y LATAM.


En Kiteris Data, el grupo de Business Intelligence de Kiteris Solutions, estamos buscando una persona para desarrollar la función de Arquitecto de datos o Data Governance.


Nuestro objetivo es comprender los retos del negocio de nuestros clientes y crear aplicaciones analíticas sólidas y escalables para ayudarlos a mejorar su proceso de análisis y toma de decisiones.


Te unirás a un proyecto europeo de alto impacto donde un equipo de expertos en datos con alta visibilidad en el programa que te mentorizarán y acompañarán en tu curva de aprendizaje. Los Data Spaces en Europa representan un esfuerzo coordinado para potenciar el uso y la compartición de datos de forma segura y estructurada, impulsando tanto la innovación tecnológica como la competitividad a nivel europeo.



Principales responsabilidades:


  • Gestión y trazabilidad de datos, asegurando alineación con los procesos de negocio.
  • Asesoramiento en gobernanza y calidad del dato, garantizando conformidad con estándares europeos (Gaia-X, IDSA).
  • Diseño y validación de arquitectura de datos en diferentes entornos del programa.
  • Estrategias de interoperabilidad y middleware para la integración con Data Spaces europeos.
  • Identificación y cumplimiento de estándares de seguridad en almacenamiento y manejo de datos (GDPR).
  • Colaboración en la definición y estandarización de APIs de datos.
  • Evaluación de riesgos en infraestructura de datos y recomendación de estrategias de mitigación.
  • Revisión y validación de modelos de datos y ontologías para garantizar interoperabilidad.
  • Evaluación de escenarios técnicos y arquitectónicos, asegurando su viabilidad.
  • Coordinación con equipos de desarrollo, arquitectura y QA para asegurar calidad y cumplimiento.
  • Revisión de documentación técnica y entregables.



Experiencia y actitudes/aptitudes necesarias:

Generales:

  • Inglés B2 – C1 imprescindible
  • Permiso de trabajo en España.
  • Mentalidad analítica.
  • Trabajo en equipo.
  • Actitud proactiva y ganas de aprender.


Técnicas:

  • Experiencia sólida en Gobernanza y Arquitectura de Datos.
  • Background técnico en proyectos de Data.
  • Conocimientos en gestión de proyectos y coordinación de equipos.
  • Capacidad analítica y enfoque crítico para evaluar escenarios técnicos y arquitectónicos.



¿Qué ofrecemos?

  • Trabajo 100% en remoto.
  • Flexibilidad horaria.
  • Contrato indefinido.
  • Incorporación inmediata.
  • Revisión salarial continuada.
  • Plan de carrera profesional en empresa en crecimiento.
  • La posibilidad de aprender y analizar diferentes modelos de negocio (Empresas de servicios IT, comercialización eléctrica, empresas de consumo, empresas del sector agrícola, empresas del sector industrial...).
  • Formación continua en tecnología, soft-skills e inglés.
  • Seguro médico privado cofinanciado.
  • Ticket restaurante, transporte y guardería.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Información clave:

Equipo: Repsol Electricidad y Gas / Analítica de cartera, mercado y modelos predictivos

Localización: Madrid, España

Nivel de experiencia: +3 años

Tipo de trabajo: híbrido

Requisitos: inglés B2 o superior + Licenciatura o superior + Dominio de SQL

El equipo al que te unes:

Te unirás a la Dirección de Retail de Electricidad y Gas y más concretamente al área de Analítica de cartera, mercado y modelos predictivos, donde tu misión será desarrollar y mantener cuadros de mando para el análisis y visualización de datos relacionados con la cartera de clientes y el churn de Repsol Electricidad y Gas.

Este rol implica trabajar tanto en la preparación de datos desde diferentes fuentes de datos para construir cubos OLAP, como en la creación de visualizaciones en PowerBI; además de realizar análisis avanzados de cartera y mercado.

Durante el desarrollo del puesto, tendrás la oportunidad de poder coordinar y supervisar equipo técnico de apoyo en la construcción de cuadros de mando.

Principales tareas:


Diseñar y construir el modelo de datos y los cuadros de mando para el reporting de cartera y churn.
Implementar procesos de ETL en SQL desde los orígenes, pasando por tablas de hechos, hasta los cubos OLAP finales.
Desarrollar visualizaciones interactivas en PowerBI adaptados a las necesidades del negocio.
Realizar análisis avanzados de cartera y supervivencia de clientes para identificar tendencias en la cartera y en el mercado.
Traducir necesidades del negocio en procesos operativos, informes o análisis que ayuden a tomar decisiones.



Encajarás en el puesto si:


Cuentas con titulación Superior: Ingeniería, ADE, Matemáticas, Físicas o similar.
Aportas experiencia con bases de datos y trabajas con SQL nivel avanzado (se hará prueba técnica)
Tienes experiencia construyendo informes en herramientas de reporting (similares a PowerBI).
Has trabajado en departamentos mixtos de analytics-negocio donde se traduzcan las necesidades del mundo real a procesos implantados en sistemas.
Necesitaremos que también tengas un nivel alto de ingles, mínimo B2
Valoremos que aportes al equipo: Experiencia en PowerBI, conocimiento de SAS y SAS Macro y familiaridad con herramientas y lenguajes como R, Python, Snowflake y NoSQL y otras nuevas tecnologías.



Qué ofrecemos:


Contrato indefinido
Bonus según objetivos
Seguro médico
Aportación a plan de pensiones
Desconexión digital
Medidas de conciliación
Asesoría legal
Servicios de apoyo al empleado



Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Fleming was founded with the goal of creating high-quality digital health, wellness, and AI programs globally. We seek to make people's lives happier, healthier, and more productive by creating empowering self-growth products for everyday life. Our team of experts ranges from innovative AI specialists, creative minds, and imaginative designers to professional medical doctors and data scientists, working together as one to help millions of people around the world.




With 1,2+ million customers worldwide, we're providing unique opportunities, attracting talents to join our fast-growing team, and creating innovative brands in a rapidly growing digital health industry. If you think you're bold, ambitious, and not afraid to challenge yourself, let's talk!




We are looking




We are seeking an analytical and detail-oriented Data Analyst to drive data insights across our organization. You will be responsible for analyzing data, developing performance reports, integrating complex datasets. You will collaborate closely with stakeholders, providing insights and recommendations that directly influence key business metrics.




Get ready to

Employ tools like Excel, BigQuery, SQL, and Looker Studio to enhance data quality, efficiency, and deliver accurate and timely data.
Identify, investigate, and solve data issues: data quality, discrepancies, and missing values.
Contribute to the development and improvement of data solutions.
Leverage the power of BigQuery and SQL to overcome complex modeling challenges with a focus on performance, robustness, and scalability.
Work on prevention and alerting solutions to ensure data integrity.
Adopt and refine our best practices, including naming conventions, data modeling, and data quality testing.
Communicate effectively with cross-functional teams and non-technical stakeholders in a clear and structured way.
Assist and support team members in designing, developing, and implementing reporting and analytics solutions.
Take ownership of tasks and drive initiatives forward.




We expect you to

Have proven SQL skills: ability to join and manipulate data of various types (String, Integer, JSON, Array), write parameterized scripts, and debug SQL code.
Be proficient in Excel, with experience handling complex spreadsheets and reporting.
Have strong communication skills: timely, clear, and consistent sharing of progress, bottlenecks, and findings.
Maintain a curious and growth-oriented mindset with a passion for learning.
Be capable of understanding, tackling, and communicating problems from both technical and business perspectives.
Be fluent in English and Lithuanian.




Our Benefits & Perks

Daily Meals: Enjoy a fresh breakfast and lunch in the office every day. On Fridays, we treat ourselves to a lunch out at San Diego Pub.
Snacks & Refreshments: Unlimited drinks, snacks, fresh fruits, and veggies – always something to keep you energized.
Great Office Location: Our modern office is located in the heart of Sapiegos Park, Antakalnis – a peaceful and green environment that’s perfect for work and relaxation.
Birthday Recognition: We celebrate your birthday with thoughtful gifts to make your day a little extra special.
Work-from-Home Flexibility: Take advantage of one home office day each week to enjoy a better work-life balance.




Salary

Gross salary range is 2500-3800 EUR/month.

*Salary is negotiable depending on experience.




Location

We have an amazing office in the heart of Antakalnis, Vilnius, overlooking the Sapiegos Park, which offers spectacular views in every season.

Show more
