Title: Sr. Data Analyst
Description:
What You'll Do:


Act as the main analytics point of contact for Criteo’s largest clients in the Americas
Partner with commercial teams to create and deliver Client Business Reviews, including custom analyses, optimization recommendations, media plans and forecasts to improve performance and drive incremental revenue
Design, manage, analyze, and communicate results of controlled A/B tests
Create and share market trends and benchmarks to support in strategic planning
Collaborate with Product Analytics to execute on performance-improving initiatives
Influence the Product Roadmap by sharing client needs and feedback with our product and R&D teams
Leverage the partnership with our Global Client Operations Center to identify ways to improve efficiency in executing tasks through automation or delegation
Develop expertise on a key growth area of the business. Take ownership over knowledge sharing within the team and building client facing collateral
Troubleshoot campaign delivery and performance issues in time-sensitive, high-impact scenarios
Stay informed on industry trends and advancements in AdTech, analytics, forecasting, and attribution
Effectively communicate with teams and managers on project timelines and challenges



Who You Are:


Minimum 5 years of full-time, analytics-relevant experience
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience
Native-level English fluency
Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to manipulate data sets to identify patterns and insights, and recommend actionable strategies
Excel in data storytelling and crafting impactful presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences
Conceptual and practical understanding of statistics, A/B testing, and experimental design
Proficiency in SQL, Python, and Tableau for automating analyses and creating compelling visualizations
Exceptional client and stakeholder management skills
Thrive when faced with ambiguity; able to select the best solution from various analytics techniques
Team player who helps to foster a collaborative, inclusive, and learning-forward environment
Proactive, organized, and able to effectively prioritize tasks



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

For employees based in the US, certain roles at Criteo are eligible for additional rewards, including quarterly or annual bonus and restricted stock units. US-based employees receive access to healthcare, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, family forming and wellness benefits, Flexible Work financial support, learning opportunities, and a robust annual leave plan including volunteer time off and summer vacation days.

The US base salary pay range for this position per year is:

$95,000 - $139,500


Show more
HTML:
What You'll Do:

  • Act as the main analytics point of contact for Criteo’s largest clients in the Americas
  • Partner with commercial teams to create and deliver Client Business Reviews, including custom analyses, optimization recommendations, media plans and forecasts to improve performance and drive incremental revenue
  • Design, manage, analyze, and communicate results of controlled A/B tests
  • Create and share market trends and benchmarks to support in strategic planning
  • Collaborate with Product Analytics to execute on performance-improving initiatives
  • Influence the Product Roadmap by sharing client needs and feedback with our product and R&D teams
  • Leverage the partnership with our Global Client Operations Center to identify ways to improve efficiency in executing tasks through automation or delegation
  • Develop expertise on a key growth area of the business. Take ownership over knowledge sharing within the team and building client facing collateral
  • Troubleshoot campaign delivery and performance issues in time-sensitive, high-impact scenarios
  • Stay informed on industry trends and advancements in AdTech, analytics, forecasting, and attribution
  • Effectively communicate with teams and managers on project timelines and challenges


Who You Are:

  • Minimum 5 years of full-time, analytics-relevant experience
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience
  • Native-level English fluency
  • Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to manipulate data sets to identify patterns and insights, and recommend actionable strategies
  • Excel in data storytelling and crafting impactful presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences
  • Conceptual and practical understanding of statistics, A/B testing, and experimental design
  • Proficiency in SQL, Python, and Tableau for automating analyses and creating compelling visualizations
  • Exceptional client and stakeholder management skills
  • Thrive when faced with ambiguity; able to select the best solution from various analytics techniques
  • Team player who helps to foster a collaborative, inclusive, and learning-forward environment
  • Proactive, organized, and able to effectively prioritize tasks


We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

For employees based in the US, certain roles at Criteo are eligible for additional rewards, including quarterly or annual bonus and restricted stock units. US-based employees receive access to healthcare, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, family forming and wellness benefits, Flexible Work financial support, learning opportunities, and a robust annual leave plan including volunteer time off and summer vacation days.

The US base salary pay range for this position per year is:

$95,000 - $139,500

Title: Sr. Data Analyst-Marketing
Description:
About Semgrep

Our mission is to make world-class software security available to everyone. This means building program analysis tools that are open source, easy to use, powerful, and fast. It also means building a team with security expertise and a passion for great developer experiences. Most of all, it means working with honesty and respect in a diverse community of dreamers and builders. We’ve redefined static analysis tooling by committing to all of these, and turned our project, Semgrep, into an essential safeguard for code at Snowflake, Dropbox, and more.

About The Role

As a Senior Data Analyst working with the Marketing and Revenue Marketing team, you’ll be instrumental in shaping data-driven marketing strategies that drive measurable growth across our revenue organization, including demand generation, channel partnerships, and sales. In this role, you’ll build and optimize data infrastructure that delivers actionable insights, empowering the team to make high-impact, data-informed decisions. Leveraging advanced analytics and predictive modeling, you’ll help forecast marketing trends and inform strategic investment choices. You’ll also take ownership of data integrity, working closely with marketing operations to ensure quality data collection and analysis. A cross-functional role across our Data and Marketing teams, you’ll play a pivotal role in aligning analytics with our marketing vision and maximizing campaign effectiveness through experimentation and robust KPI tracking. Growth opportunities include embedding deeper into the Marketing team, expanding into analytical work with our Product & Engineering teams, or growing more technically into Data Engineering and Data Science roles.

What You'll Achieve


Build and Automate Reporting Solutions: Work with leaders across marketing and revenue teams to create easy-to-use reporting tools that promote transparency and accountability. Automate routine reports to give Revenue Operations clear, valuable insights and more time to focus on strategic work.
Drive Data-Backed Marketing Strategies: Use data to shape strategies in demand generation, account-based marketing (ABM), and channel partnerships. Set up performance metrics that guide smart decisions as we expand our marketing channels, ensuring our resources are used effectively.
Lead Customer Acquisition Forecasting: Own the customer acquisition forecast process within Revenue Operations, working closely with Finance to track progress toward goals. Use predictive analytics to anticipate trends and help the team stay ahead of changing customer needs.
Ensure Data Quality Across Systems: Partner with Business Systems to improve data quality and reliability, making sure all processes and tools work smoothly together. Take the lead in ensuring data accuracy and setting up reliable data collection and reporting practices.
Use Advanced Analytics to Improve Campaigns: Apply statistical methods like A/B testing to dig into campaign performance and find opportunities for improvement. Support marketing operations by helping optimize our technology setup so it can deliver clear, actionable insights for the team
Ensure Data Integrity and Quality: Build and maintain processes that guarantee high-quality, accurate data collection and reporting, serving as a key steward of data integrity within the revenue marketing team.
Drive Predictive Analytics and Modeling: Leverage advanced analytics and predictive modeling to forecast marketing trends, guiding strategy and anticipating customer needs.
Optimize Marketing Investments: Support budget optimization by providing data-backed analyses that inform resource allocation, helping prioritize initiatives with the greatest revenue impact.
Enhance Marketing Technology Stack: Collaborate with the marketing operations team to optimize our technology stack, ensuring it supports comprehensive analytics and seamless reporting.


You are ideal for this role if you have


3+ Years of Relevant Experience: Extensive experience in Data Analytics, Growth Analytics, or Business Intelligence, with a focus on leveraging data to drive strategic decisions. Experience working with or directly in Revenue Operations or Sales Operations teams such as building go-to-market (GTM) metrics or informing marketing strategies and sales initiatives a plus.
Expert SQL Proficiency: Mastery of SQL for querying and manipulating large datasets, coupled with familiarity with Salesforce, Marketo (or comparable marketing automation tools), and a BI tool (Tableau, Looker, Power BI, etc.) to create insightful reports and dashboards. Experience working with OLAP Databases (Snowflake, Amazon Redshift, Google BigQuery, ClickHouse, Databricks) a plus.
Python Experience: Experience with using or interest in learning to use Python or Jupyter Notebook/iPythonNotebook for simple analytics, financial modeling, data ETL, etc. a plus.
Data-Driven Problem Solver: Proven ability to translate complex business processes and data into actionable analytics solutions that address key business questions.
Strong Dimensional Modeling and Data Warehousing Knowledge: Deep understanding of dimensional modeling principles and data warehousing concepts to design and maintain efficient data structures.
Cross-Functional Collaboration Skills: Demonstrated ability to work effectively across teams, understanding the underlying needs behind data requests to deliver tailored analytics solutions.
Data Quality and Troubleshooting Expertise: Experience in identifying and resolving data discrepancies, working closely with Business Systems and Engineering teams to address upstream data issues and improve data integrity.
Curiosity and Analytical Mindset: A strong desire to understand complex systems and processes, with a knack for creating clarity and order from chaotic data environments.
Constructive Attitude Toward Improvement: A balanced approach to evaluation, with the ability to recognize what’s working well while identifying opportunities for enhancement.


Compensation/Location

Preference for 2-3 days per week in one of our office locations (SF/NY/Boston/Denver)

Salary Range: $133,000 - $181,500

Our compensation package includes equity and benefits in addition to salary.

Please note that the range listed is for someone based in the San Francisco Bay Area.

What We Offer

Our goal is to competitively and fairly compensate every Semgrep employee with a system that equally rewards those who are vocal and those who are less comfortable making demands during the final steps of the hiring process. To that end, we generate internal compensation bands that are used when discussing and negotiating salaries. We update these based on market data to make sure they’re above the average for comparable roles.

We also invest in our employees’ well-being and long term success with comprehensive health plans, generous vacation time, 401k, learning stipends, and more. Our benefits are for everyone, so that you’re taken care of, and we work with individuals to make sure they have what they need, whether that’s quiet work space, adjusted hours, or something else.

Who We Are

We have people from France and the Philippines, physics and philosophy, formal methods research and full fledged corporations. We’re new parents and new grads, aspiring authors and aspiring Americans, dog lovers and dogfooders. We get together often to bike, bake, and meet up in parks. In our interactions, we believe respect and honesty go hand in hand, and prioritize both.

Semgrep is an equal-opportunity employer seeking a diverse range of backgrounds. We value who you are — including your cultural heritage, your socioeconomic status, your age, your race, your gender, your sexual orientation, your disabilities. We value what’s vitally important to you — your family, your religion, your politics. We value what you love in this world — your music, your weekend pursuits. We believe in welcoming varied professional backgrounds, educations, and interests. If you’re exceptional in your role, believe in Semgrep’s mission, and treat Semgrep’s values as your own, you belong here.

Title: Data Specialist
Description:
Job Title: Data Strategy Lead (Data Strategist)

Duration: 04 Months (with possible renewable)

Location: QUINCY, MA - HYBRID




JOB DESCRIPTION:




POSITION SUMMARY:

The Data Strategy Lead will provide thought leadership within the organization and determine strengths, weaknesses, operational effectiveness and opportunities for the modernization of data. The Data Strategy Lead recommends initiatives from internal and external factors that minimize risks and support policy and regulation to formulate plans that achieve the long-term goals of the overall Data Modernization Initiative (DMI).




The Strategy Lead will support, and contribute to, the development of a long-term organizational strategy related to data life cycle management, data storage, security and compliance measures, and analytics products to be used cross functionally




The Strategy Lead will use razor sharp emotional intelligence to align interdepartmental goals and priorities with the realities of resource constraints and regulatory limitations; all with a longer-term vision of a modern data stack capable of repeatably surfacing insights necessary to provide the best possible service to members.







JOB DUTIES:

• Become proficient in understanding, communicating, and advocating for the Agencies objectives.

• Understand the current challenges and how to measure them in terms of risk and impact to short, medium, and long-term objectives.

• Perform Gap analysis and process improvement ideation.

• Work with senior leadership and agency program teams to create strategy frameworks and roadmaps.

• Build and nurture relationships with cross functional business partners and leaders from teams inside and outside

• Lead cross functional, internal teams through various projects.

• Participate in, and facilitate, meetings across all levels as well as create and/or contribute to relevant documentation.




SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS (Special Skill Set, Abilities & Knowledge):




• Sufficient knowledge of the modern data stack to provide thought leadership across the organization – i.e., Tableau, Snowflake, Informatica, AWS.

• Previous experience supporting or participating in data teams, such as data integration, data warehousing, analytics or reporting.

• Strong problem-solving, with demonstrated expertise in identifying, scoping, breaking down, and resolving complex problems through structured processes.

• Ability to understand complex data and how it fuels business needs.

• Demonstrated understanding of project management principles and practices coupled with the ability to coordinate numerous projects simultaneously to successful completion.

• The ability to navigate a bureaucratic environment that makes use of matrixed support teams.

• Willingness to build an understanding of legacy processes and fill out necessary tickets and collateral to initiate internal processes

• Strong relationship building capabilities with a strong customer service orientation and the ability to understand customer needs

• Skilled communicator and presenter, able to effectively communicate new concepts to a diverse and varied audience

• Build bridges that synergize the working relationships of IT and Business.




EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE: (Education, Years Experience & Certificates):




• Minimum (3) three years of experience in a project or program management role, managing programs from conceptualization through delivery

• Minimum (5) five years of experience in an IT or Analytics role

• Proficiency with MS Office applications including Excel, Word, Visio, Outlook, and PowerPoint

• Working knowledge of data management tools – Tableau, Snowflake, AWS, Informatica or equivalent technologies.

• Solid understanding of various data storage solutions – RDB, Data Mart, Data Warehouse, Data Lake and why/when they are used.

• Skilled communicator who is able to translate between technical and business resources and concepts

• Experience in a health care setting is preferred but not required.

• Experience working in state government preferred but not required.

• Strong problem-solving, with demonstrated expertise in identifying, scoping, breaking down, and resolving complex problems through structured processes.

• Ability to understand complex data and how it fuels business needs.

• Demonstrated understanding of project management principles and practices coupled with the ability to coordinate numerous projects simultaneously to successful completion.

• The ability to navigate a bureaucratic environment that makes use of matrixed support teams.

• Willingness to build an understanding of legacy processes and fill out necessary tickets and collateral to initiate internal processes

• Strong relationship building capabilities with a strong customer service orientation and the ability to understand customer needs

• Skilled communicator and presenter, able to effectively communicate new concepts to a diverse and varied audience

• Build bridges that synergize the working relationships of IT and Business.


EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE: (Education, Years Experience & Certificates):


• Minimum (3) three years of experience in a project or program management role, managing programs from conceptualization through delivery

• Minimum (5) five years of experience in an IT or Analytics role

• Proficiency with MS Office applications including Excel, Word, Visio, Outlook, and PowerPoint

• Working knowledge of data management tools – Tableau, Snowflake, AWS, Informatica or equivalent technologies.

• Solid understanding of various data storage solutions – RDB, Data Mart, Data Warehouse, Data Lake and why/when they are used.

• Skilled communicator who is able to translate between technical and business resources and concepts

• Experience in a health care setting is preferred but not required.

• Experience working in state government preferred but not required.

Title: Healthcare Data Analyst- Neuroscience Center: Hybrid
Description:
The Healthcare Data Analyst is member of the Neuroscience Center Safety & Quality Program and delivers readily available and actionable data to inform team decision-making in driving a culture of continuous quality improvement for our patients, families, and staff.

In This Role, The Healthcare Data Analyst Will


Advise and collaborate with the Neuroscience Center staff on analytics of healthcare data, including quality, patient, and financial, to support reporting needs. Research, design, develop, implement, and maintain reporting and analytical systems in the context of the hospital's clinical and/or financial systems. Process data requests.
Provide analysis, management, and methodological support through the development of measurement plans for performance indicators, including process and outcome measures.
Perform standardized data validation activities including utilizing benchmarking databases (EPIC, Micro strategy, and PHIS) to ensure the highest quality information for decision-making.
Prepare written and graphical reports utilizing appropriate QI data analytics techniques including development of dashboards, scorecards, and databases to track performance over time and highlight data-driven opportunities and recommendations for improvement.
Provide QI analytical and technical guidance, education, and mentorship to faculty, residents/fellows, nursing, and other staff.
Maintain knowledge of current healthcare analytics industry and hospital trends, tools, and resources to continuously improve Neuroscience Center reporting.


To Qualify For This Role, Please Have The Following


2 years of experience using data analytic tools in a health care-related setting; related advanced degree is preferred.
Degree in computer science, data analytical fields such as economics, MPH, and data analytics boot camp preferred.


Skills


Data interpretation tools (run, control/statistical control process, Pareto charts, and other measurement tools) and data extraction from data repositories such as EPIC, Microstrategy, and PHIS.
Excel (Pivot Tables and Charts); Smart Sheet; SigmaXL or SQC
SQL syntax and coding practices and experience with dimensional data modeling concepts used in data warehousing, business intelligence, and business analytics applications is preferred.
Analytical skills to translate reporting needs expressed in clinical or operational terms to technical solutions based on existing data, data structures, and query tool functionality.
Communication skills to effectively deal with conflicting views or issues, mediate fair solutions, provide empathy in difficult interpersonal situations, and well-developed writing skills.


Values


A strong sense of accountability/responsibility to support getting tasks done well; strong organizational skills, detail-oriented, and able to manage competing priorities.
A desire for learning with initiative to do so.
A passion for thinking of innovative ways to problem solve and improve processes and outcomes.
A passion for quality improvement with a “go-getter” attitude and great interpersonal skills who enjoys working with others


Boston Children’s Hospital offers competitive compensation and unmatched benefits including flexible schedules, affordable health, vision and dental insurance, child care and student loan subsidies, generous levels of time off, 403(b) Retirement Savings plan, Pension, Tuition and certain License and Certification Reimbursement, cell phone plan discounts and discounted rates on T-passes. Experience the benefits of passion and teamwork.

**Cover letters highly encouraged**

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst - GTM
Description:
The Revenue Operations Data Analyst will be responsible for supporting the Revenue Operations team by gathering, analyzing, and presenting data related to sales, marketing, and customer success performance. The analyst will provide critical data insights to inform strategy, improve forecasting accuracy, and support operational efficiency. This position offers an exciting opportunity for a detail-oriented, analytical professional to make a measurable impact on the company’s growth trajectory.

Boston Dynamics is a world leader in mobile robots, tackling some of the toughest robotics challenges. For years, our awe-inspiring viral videos on YouTube have shown the world what remarkably capable robots can do. Now we are quickly becoming a recognized leader in automation solutions for industrial applications, logistics and warehouses.

Key Responsibilities


Data Analysis & Reporting
Create and maintain reports, dashboards, and decks that tell a story, communicating progress against targets and actionable insights to GTM leadership.
Ensure that data is easily accessible and presented in a clear and understandable format for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Forecasting & Trend Analysis
Collaborate with RevOps Insights Manager to develop and refine accurate sales forecasts based on historical conversion rates and pipeline health.
Monitor leading indicators to identify potential risks or opportunities for revenue growth.
Collaboration & Cross-Functional Support:
Act as a go-to expert for data-related inquiries from sales, marketing, and customer success teams.
Perform ad-hoc analyses, assist with special projects, and develop custom reports as needed to support various GTM initiatives and strategic goals.
Assist with special projects that require data analysis and reporting, such as system migrations, tool implementations, or process overhauls.

Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in data science, business analytics, or a related field.
Minimum two years experience with proven experience in data analysis and insights generation, preferably in a revenue operations or related role.
Strong working knowledge of analytics tools including SQL, Snowflake, and Tableau.
Experience with Salesforce reporting and dashboard creation preferred.
Proficiency in data visualization tools, business intelligence platforms, and statistical analysis software.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical-thinking skills.
Strong organization and execution skills, including ability to operate in ambiguity and drive multiple strategic initiatives simultaneously
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders.


We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, we are not able to sponsor visas for this position.


Show more

Title: Data Management Analyst - Investment Management - Boston, MA - 26061
Description:
Data Management Analyst – Investment Management – Boston, MA

We are seeking candidates for a Data Management Analyst position with a top-tier Investment Management firm based in Boston, MA. This position is an entry level, clerical role that will focus on processing and transaction-based tasks. The candidate will assist with monitoring data or service quality and resolve issues The ideal candidate is energetic, efficient, and eager to learn with 0-2 years of experience in financial services or data quality experience.

This is a 6 month contract that will pay $25-33/hr within a 40-hour work week. This candidate is required to be onsite 3 days/wk.

Responsibilities:


Provides support and information for reporting and data updates. May monitor a variety of data checks to ensure accuracy to minimize risk
Communicate data trends and issues to the manager and help determine a solution to assist in the resolution
Under manager supervision interacts and coordinates with other departments to resolve questions and problems
Assists the subject matter expert for data related projects. Dedicates time to meeting with Business Units to scope out work
May create and produce reports as required to support business users at all levels
Takes on special projects and additional responsibilities as requested
Works to find processes that will enhance efficiencies within team
Assists in creating new processes and resolves day to day issues by working with manager
Creates guidelines and training peers on new efficiencies that the team has taken over


Qualifications:


Bachelor’s degree in business, finance or math-related field, or equivalent work experience
Minimum of 0-2+ years of Financial Services industry or data quality experience
Experience using applications and/or technology systems currently used by the business
Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Excel with the ability to compare data from various sources
Strong database knowledge and Macro programming ability
Ability to work independently, manage multiple tasks, prioritize work, and meet deadlines
Strong analytical, decision-making skills and attention to detail
Ability to build and maintain productive working relationships within a team
Strong problem solving, communication, partnership, and interpersonal skills, collaborating with all organizational levels across the organization
Strong written and oral communication skills
Ability to work well within a team environment as well as exercising independent judgment


If you are interested in learning more about this opportunity, please email your resume to Allie at aross@daleyaa.com.

Title: Associate Analytics & Reporting Specialist
Description:
About Us

Here at National Grid, we connect homes and businesses to power, making sure supply and demand match each other. We make sure the lights are on in schools, operating theatres, and sporting arenas; we’re thousands of people working on behalf of millions of people. And whatever your role, wherever you work with us, you’ll help us hit stretching targets and achieve our far-reaching goal: to secure, clean energy that supports our world far into the future. Here, you will be at the heart of energy.

At National Grid, we work towards the highest standards in everything we do, including how we support, value, and develop our people. Our aim is to encourage and support employees to thrive and be the best they can be. We celebrate the difference people can bring into our organization, and welcome and encourage applicants with diverse experiences and backgrounds, and offer flexible and tailored support, at home and in the office.

Our function covers a diverse range of categories from Indirect, IT & Digital, Network Operations (Maintenance & Repair), Gas equipment and Services to large scale Construction and Network Equipment, with a clear mission: to enable a clean, fair, and affordable energy future through commercial, responsible and innovative supply chain leadership. 

The Opportunity

An exciting opportunity has arisen for an Associate Analytics and Reporting Specialist to join our team on a Full Time, Permanent basis!

The Associate Procurement Analytics and Reporting Specialist is responsible for supporting the procurement department by analyzing data, generating reports, and providing insights to optimize procurement processes.

National Grid is leading the charge towards a Net Zero future in the UK and NE of USA. We recognize that decarbonizing our electric and gas systems will require resolving many questions and seeking new partnerships, technologies, and transformative investments.  Over the next 5 years, we will be investing over £60bn across our UK and US businesses – nearly double the investment over the past 5 years.  This is an exciting time for our industry that is creating significant opportunities for National Grid; this is not just a moment in time; it's a game-changing era that will shape National Grid's success for decades to come.

Given this backdrop, our supply chains are facing an unprecedented set of challenges and are at the forefront of our plans, placing National Grid Procurement at the center of our Net Zero goals. We have set out an ambitious transformation plan, focused on becoming a client of choice for our supply partners whilst ensuring outstanding outcomes for our Business Units (BUs).  Our strategy revolves around significant changes in three core areas:


Partnering: We are forging closer ties with our supply chain, aligning ourselves more closely with each NG Group Business Unit (BU).
Scale: We are leveraging the immense scale of our group to unlock even greater potential. By harnessing our collective strength, we can achieve remarkable things.
Operational Transformation: We are revolutionizing the way we work as a team. Embracing new approaches and technologies, we are streamlining processes and making the day-to-day job simpler and more efficient.



What You'll Do

This role will work closely with the procurement team to identify key performance indicators, track metrics, and develop strategies to enhance procurement efficiency and cost-effectiveness.


Collect, clean, and analyze procurement data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement. This includes data related to supplier spend, savings opportunities, procurement cycle times, and other relevant metrics.
Ensure the accuracy and integrity of procurement data by implementing data quality controls, performing regular audits and data cleansing exercises, and resolving any discrepancies or issues.
Develop and maintain reports and dashboards to provide regular updates on procurement performance. These reports should be accurate, concise, and visually engaging, enabling stakeholders to make informed decisions.
Interpret data analysis results and provide insights to the procurement team, highlighting areas for improvement and cost-saving opportunities. Collaborate with stakeholders to develop strategies and action plans based on these insights.
Work closely with cross-functional teams, such as finance, operations, and supply chain, to gather relevant data and align procurement activities with organizational goals.
Assist in the implementation of procurement projects by providing analytical support. This may involve conducting market research, supplier evaluations, and cost-benefit analyses.
Keep abreast of industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in procurement analytics. Continuously enhance knowledge and skills to improve performance and contribute to the development of innovative procurement strategies.



Requirements


Bachelor’s degree level in Data Science, Engineering or other related field; or equivalent 3 years’ relevant experience minimum
Strong analytical skills with experience in data analysis and reporting.
Proficiency in data visualization tools and software, such as Microsoft Excel, Tableau, or Power BI.
Knowledge of procurement processes, supplier management, and cost optimization.
Familiarity with statistical analysis and modelling techniques.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Attention to detail and ability to work with large datasets.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.
Prior experience in procurement or supply chain analytics is preferred.



Your Rewards

Rewarding work and a collaborative, team-oriented culture is just the beginning. Review our digital benefit guide at ngbenefitslivebrighter.com for full details and descriptions.

Additional Information

This role is offered on a Full-Time, Permanent basis.

We are also offering hybrid / flexible working where travel to the office will be as per business need.

This role can be located: Waltham, MA

Waltham: $63,000- $74,000 a year

This role closes on 9/2/24. However, we strongly encourage candidates to submit their application as early as possible, as applications will be actively reviewed and processed prior to the deadline.

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

National Grid is an equal opportunity employer that values a broad diversity of talent, knowledge, experience and expertise. We foster a culture of inclusion that drives employee engagement to deliver superior performance to the communities we serve. National Grid is proud to be an affirmative action employer. We encourage minorities, women, individuals with disabilities and protected veterans to join the National Grid team.
Show more

Waltham: $63,000- $74,000 a year

This role closes on 9/2/24. However, we strongly encourage candidates to submit their application as early as possible, as applications will be actively reviewed and processed prior to the deadline.

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

National Grid is an equal opportunity employer that values a broad diversity of talent, knowledge, experience and expertise. We foster a culture of inclusion that drives employee engagement to deliver superior performance to the communities we serve. National Grid is proud to be an affirmative action employer. Title: Customer Support Data Analyst - Business Partner
Description:
Location: Must be located in Massachusetts - this is a Hybrid role. Our office location is 333 Summer Street, Boston MA

Are you bready* to build for success?

As a Senior Customer Care Analyst, you will support the Care organization in getting behind the “Why” and the “How” of our customer interactions using a business-focused analytical skill set. Our team is passionate about using data to better understand the customer experience and bringing insights to action. This includes analyzing contact drivers and customer intents as well as our internal processes and policies for handling customers’ needs and pain points. In this role, you will work in close partnership with our Care Operational Excellence team to inform and prioritize roadmaps as well as our Workforce Management and Agent teams to coordinate our use of data for driving action. Success for our team is to be able to drive change through creative, data-driven thinking, influential storytelling, and a customer-centric mindset.

The ideal candidate has a track record of delivering results in a fast-paced environment, excellent business judgment and is comfortable with owning work end-to-end. They should have a demonstrated ability to break down complex problems, deliver recommendations, and have a critical eye for detail.

About this roll*:


Proactively identifies insights using a strong business acumen and understanding of our stakeholders’ priorities
Leads analysis efforts as data subject matter expert for new processes and tooling
Uses a business-case mindset to understand ROI of proposed recommendations, key assumptions, and activities needed for success
Communicates clearly, knowledgeably, and transparently with project stakeholders to build trusted relationships and enhance business outcomes.
Coordinates efforts between the Data Infrastructure and Operations teams to obtain new data sources and understand their value
Looks for opportunities to both optimize and automate analyses and develop dashboards for more efficient identification of insights
Demonstrates strong technical skills when connecting data sources, extracting data, and performing analysis


Do you have the right ingredients*?


4-6 years of experience in analytical roles.
Strong SQL skills and familiarity with building interactive dashboards in tools such as Looker or Tableau.
Experience analyzing large data sets and distilling to actionable insights.
Ability to flex between projects that balance speed to and depth of insight.
Strong data visualization skills - including ability to build quickly and accurately across different tools.
Data driven, customer centric, always curious, asking questions and anticipating challenges.
Demonstrated ability to apply business acumen to technical analytic approaches and outputs.


Special Sauce* (Nice to Haves)


Experience with analytics in a customer-focused field: customer experience, customer service, marketing, product and business operations.
Bachelor's Degree.
Experience with data platforms, extraction and automation.
Experience participating in recurring business reviews with leadership teams.


Our Spread of Total Rewards

We strive to provide competitive compensation and benefits programs that help to attract, retain, and motivate the best and brightest people in our industry. Our total rewards package goes beyond great earnings potential and provides the means to a healthy lifestyle with the flexibility to meet Toasters’ changing needs. Learn more about our benefits at https://careers.toasttab.com/toast-benefits.


Bread puns encouraged but not required




The base salary range for this role is listed below. The starting salary will be determined based on skills and experience. In addition to base salary, our total rewards components include cash compensation (overtime, bonus/commissions if eligible), equity, and benefits.

Pay Range

$99,000—$158,000 USD

We are Toasters

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion is Baked into our Recipe for Success.

At Toast our employees are our secret ingredient. When they are powered to succeed, Toast succeeds.

The restaurant industry is one of the most diverse industries. We embrace and are excited by this diversity, believing that only through authenticity, inclusivity, high standards of respect and trust, and leading with humility will we be able to achieve our goals.

Baking inclusive principles into our company and diversity into our design provides equitable opportunities for all and enhances our ability to be first in class in all aspects of our industry.

Bready* to make a change? Apply today!

Toast is committed to creating an accessible and inclusive hiring process. As part of this commitment, we strive to provide reasonable accommodations for persons with disabilities to enable them to access the hiring process. If you need an accommodation to access the job application or interview process, please contact candidateaccommodations@toasttab.com.

In this role, you will work in close partnership with our Care Operational Excellence team to inform and prioritize roadmaps as well as our Workforce Management and Agent teams to coordinate our use of data for driving action. Success for our team is to be able to drive change through creative, data-driven thinking, influential storytelling, and a customer-centric mindset.

The ideal candidate has a track record of delivering results in a fast-paced environment, excellent business judgment and is comfortable with owning work end-to-end. They should have a demonstrated ability to break down complex problems, deliver recommendations, and have a critical eye for detail.

About this roll*:

  • Proactively identifies insights using a strong business acumen and understanding of our stakeholders’ priorities
  • Leads analysis efforts as data subject matter expert for new processes and tooling
  • Uses a business-case mindset to understand ROI of proposed recommendations, key assumptions, and activities needed for success
  • Communicates clearly, knowledgeably, and transparently with project stakeholders to build trusted relationships and enhance business outcomes.
  • Coordinates efforts between the Data Infrastructure and Operations teams to obtain new data sources and understand their value
  • Looks for opportunities to both optimize and automate analyses and develop dashboards for more efficient identification of insights
  • Demonstrates strong technical skills when connecting data sources, extracting data, and performing analysis

Do you have the right ingredients*?

  • 4-6 years of experience in analytical roles.
  • Strong SQL skills and familiarity with building interactive dashboards in tools such as Looker or Tableau.
  • Experience analyzing large data sets and distilling to actionable insights.
  • Ability to flex between projects that balance speed to and depth of insight.
  • Strong data visualization skills - including ability to build quickly and accurately across different tools.
  • Data driven, customer centric, always curious, asking questions and anticipating challenges.
  • Demonstrated ability to apply business acumen to technical analytic approaches and outputs.

Special Sauce* (Nice to Haves)

  • Experience with analytics in a customer-focused field: customer experience, customer service, marketing, product and business operations.
  • Bachelor's Degree.
  • Experience with data platforms, extraction and automation.
  • Experience participating in recurring business reviews with leadership teams.

Our Spread of Total Rewards

We strive to provide competitive compensation and benefits programs that help to attract, retain, and motivate the best and brightest people in our industry. Our total rewards package goes beyond great earnings potential and provides the means to a healthy lifestyle with the flexibility to meet Toasters’ changing needs. Learn more about our benefits at https://careers.toasttab.com/toast-benefits.

  • Bread puns encouraged but not required



The base salary range for this role is listed below. The starting salary will be determined based on skills and experience. In addition to base salary, our total rewards components include cash compensation (overtime, bonus/commissions if eligible), equity, and benefits.

Pay Range

$99,000—$158,000 USD

We are Toasters

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion is Baked into our Recipe for Success.

At Toast our employees are our secret ingredient. When they are powered to succeed, Toast succeeds.

The restaurant industry is one of the most diverse industries. We embrace and are excited by this diversity, believing that only through authenticity, inclusivity, high standards of respect and trust, and leading with humility will we be able to achieve our goals.

Baking inclusive principles into our company and diversity into our design provides equitable opportunities for all and enhances our ability to be first in class in all aspects of our industry.

Bready* to make a change? Apply today!

Toast is committed to creating an accessible and inclusive hiring process. As part of this commitment, we strive to provide reasonable accommodations for persons with disabilities to enable them to access the hiring process. If you need an accommodation to access the job application or interview process, please contact candidateaccommodations@toasttab.com.

Title: Analyst, Customer Analytics
Description:
Overview

Why join?

Join us in revolutionizing an entire industry's customer engagement. We prioritize human connection through technology. If you're driven by purpose and want to make a meaningful impact on people's lives, this is the place for you. Our team challenges norms with the support of a trusted American brand.


Purpose: A leading professional services firm found that AAA Life associates demonstrate some of the highest levels of commitment, empathy, and dedication when compared to top U.S. companies in a benchmark analysis.
Growth: We have the privilege to offer our products to tens of millions of Americans that make up the AAA member base
Focus is on “working families”, “everyday Americans”, “ordinary citizens”, “mainstream population” “average income households”, providing life insurance products that truly impact people's lives (more information will be provided in the interview).
Team (Culture): USA Today named us a 2024 top US workplace


Who are we looking for?

The Analyst, Customer Analytics will be responsible for harnessing data from across the organization to create automated, insightful reports and analyses that reveal key trends, optimize performance, and drive strategic decision-making. You'll evaluate processes, use advanced statistical methods, and develop models to unlock business opportunities, improve customer experience, and boost sales and retention. Partnering with cross-functional teams, you'll shape data transformation initiatives, streamline reporting processes, and deliver impactful presentations to leadership and the board. Your contributions will directly support critical important metrics and help shape the future of the organization through data-driven innovation.

Responsibilities

How will you contribute?


Access and leverage data from across various areas of the organization to develop automated, easy to understand reports and ad hoc analyses that effectively answer questions, identify patterns and highlight operational metrics across the organization.
Assist with analyzing data to evaluate process effectiveness and performance across multiple dimensions.
Help to develop and implement processes that maximize statistical methods, scenario planning, and model development to optimize business outcomes.
Proactively seek out new opportunities to increase sales, improve retention and improve the customer experience. Work with cross-functional team members to analyze potential financial and business impact.
Build presentations for leadership and board level meetings.
Actively participate in data transformation projects. Development of critical data flows from various sources to reports with a focus on automation and standardization
Support the development, implementation, testing, documentation, and ongoing validation of reporting and data processes in support of organizational KPI’s/metrics/etc.


Qualifications

What do you offer?


Bachelor’s or equivalent experience in Business Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or related technical field.
Previous experience working in a customer analytics role.
Intermediate experience in Excel. Formulas, VLOOKUP, and formatting is preferred.
Previous experience using SQL, Python, or a similar tool to query, analyze data and present results.
Previous experience using Power BI or Tableau for data visualization or dashboarding.
Diverse analytical experience that can be applied across multiple lines of business or departments.
Previous experience in insurance or financial services preferred.


What can we offer?


Enjoy a hybrid work environment that promotes work-life balance.
Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage starting from your first day.
Employer 401k match and employer contribution to a pension plan.
Generous PTO and paid parental leave to support your family needs.
Opportunities for associate engagement in various social programs and community involvement initiatives backed by the company.
Show more

Title: Marketing Insights Analyst
Description:
As a Marketing Insights Analyst, you will monitor and translate complex fundraising marketing data into clear and concise reports with actionable insights. You will work with and analyze various data sources, understand marketing KPIs, and be able to clearly connect performance data to business objectives. The ideal candidate will have a demonstrated track record of manipulating and analyzing data as well as the ability to understand, visualize and discuss marketing implications. They will also possess a curiosity to leverage data to solve business problems and develop solutions.

The THD Division is committed to helping nonprofits grow through long-term, brand-loyal donor relationships. Bringing together its core competencies in strategy, data, analytics, marketing, and creative, THD Division develops and executes insight-driven multichannel strategies to advance the mission of meaningful causes that serve our communities, our nation, and our world.

Moore is a data-driven constituent experience management (CXM) company achieving accelerated growth for clients through integrated supporter experiences across all platforms, channels and devices. We are an innovation-led company that is the largest marketing, data and fundraising company in North America serving the purpose-driven industry with clients across education, association, political and commercial sectors.

Check out www.wearemoore.com for more details.

This is a hybrid position out of our office in Lincoln, MA.

Your Impact:


Gather data from various sources, including fundraising marketing campaigns across all channels, tactics, and platforms, and utilize data analytics tools to extract meaningful insights and trends.
Translate complex data into clear and concise reports, dashboards, and presentations.
Identify key performance indicators and track metrics to measure the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and initiatives and provide actionable recommendations to optimize marketing strategies and improve performance.
Work closely with internal teams to align data analysis with business objectives and provide data-driven insights to support decision-making processes.
Develop and maintain marketing performance dashboards and reports and track and analyze key metrics related to website traffic, lead generation, conversion rates, customer engagement, and brand awareness.
Prepare comprehensive reports to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.



Your Profile:


4-6 years’ experience as a Marketing Data Analyst/Marketing Insights Analyst or similar role.
Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business administration, statistics, or a related field.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, Google Analytics, Tableau, or similar
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and data visualization tools.
Familiarity with fundraising marketing channels, SEO, SEM, and social media platforms.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Attention to detail and strong problem solving skills.



How We’ll Support You:


Join the largest marketing and fundraising company in North America serving the nonprofit industry where we prioritize innovation and professional growth.
Collaborate with industry subject matter experts with over 5,000 employees across the enterprise.
To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including comprehensive healthcare, paid holidays and generous paid time off so you can have the time and space to recharge and pursue your other passions and be with the people you care about.
Moore is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.



Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Commissions & Payroll
Description:
At Curriculum Associates (CA), we believe a diverse team leads to diversity in thinking, making our products better for teachers and students. If you read this job description, feel energized by what you see here, and believe you could bring passion and commitment to the role, but you aren’t sure you meet every qualification, please apply! Above all, we are looking for the right person!

This role is hybrid with 2-days per week in our Billerica, MA office.

The Data Analyst -- Commissions & Payroll is a hands-on role that requires a strategic thinker with a strong analytical background, who can work collaboratively across departments, has excellent problem-solving skills, and can manage multiple tasks with competing deadlines. The incumbent must possess superior Excel skills with the ability to create, understand, and manipulate advanced formulas and perform data analysis of large sets of data. The Data Analyst - Commissions & Payroll should also have prior experience with system integrations and be able to understand and troubleshoot when issues with integrations arise. Prior working knowledge of payroll & commission practices is preferred.

The impact you'll have:


Become proficient with all the company’s commission plans to allow for accurate calculation and tracking of commission payments for sales teams
Maintain and update the general ledger interface account mapping and reconcile the general ledger
Prepare various payroll reconciliation reports as part of biweekly payroll review with senior management prior to transmission of payroll
Responsible for creating and submitting monthly, quarterly, and annual payment files to process commission payments
Generate and distribute commission statements and management reports Prepare, review and process US domestic biweekly payroll for exempt and non-exempt employees in accordance with the company policies and federal and state laws Prepare and process employee changes, which may include pay increases, bonuses, commissions, tax changes, banking information, department allocation, insurance deductions, allowances, garnishments, etc.
Work closely with the Payroll Manager to ensure policies and procedures are followed
Ensure all pertinent information has been entered into the payroll system for accurate annual tax reporting
Respond timely to employee and management payroll queries and concerns Collaborate with Sales Ops, People & Culture, and Finance
Team to process new hires, terminations and transfers; and ensure sales compensation plans are issued accordingly Partners with Sales Ops and Finance Team in the development and/or redesign of commission plans and support the annual planning process by providing analytical support
Collaborate with sales teams to resolve any commission-related issues and ensure transparency Prepare a variety of ad-hoc reports as requested Assist in internal and external audits.


Who we're looking for:


Superior Excel skills with the ability to create and manipulate complex formulas and perform data analysis of large sets of data
Strong understanding and knowledge of multi-state and federal payroll, tax, and payroll laws and regulations
ADP and Workday ERP experience highly desirable
Attention to detail with a strong focus on quality and accuracy a must
Ability to handle highly confidential issues with appropriate discretion
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with a strong focus on customer service and creating rapport with employees and managers at all levels of the organization
Organizational skills to balance and prioritize work under strict deadlines


Required Education and Experience:


Minimum of 1+ year payroll or sales commissions experience with medium size company
Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance or business administration preferred


Benefits and Pay Range:

Pay Range – This role’s range is $60,750 - $99,750. The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that Curriculum Associates considers in making compensation decisions based on our Compensation Philosophy. Actual base pay within that range will vary based upon several factors including, but not limited to, prior experience and relevant skill sets. At Curriculum Associates, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances for each case. This role is also eligible to participate in the company bonus plan. The Company recognizes that minimum wage varies by location and will ensure all compensation decisions comply with applicable state and local laws.

Benefits – Benefit eligible employees (and their families) are covered by medical, dental, vision, and basic life insurance. Employees can enroll in our company’s 401k plan and receive an employer match. Employees have access to a flexible vacation and sick policy in addition to twelve paid holidays and a

winter office closure between Christmas and New Year's, as well as a number of additional perks and benefits.

Travel: Less than 10% to company offices


Show more

This role is also eligible to participate in the company bonus plan. The Company recognizes that minimum wage varies by location and will ensure all compensation decisions comply with applicable state and local laws.

Benefits – Benefit eligible employees (and their families) are covered by medical, dental, vision, and basic life insurance. Employees can enroll in our company’s 401k plan and receive an employer match. Employees have access to a flexible vacation and sick policy in addition to twelve paid holidays and a

winter office closure between Christmas and New Year's, as well as a number of additional perks and benefits.

Travel: Less than 10% to company offices

Title: Principal Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics
Description:
Our world is transforming, and PTC is leading the way. Our software brings the physical and digital worlds together, enabling companies to improve operations, create better products, and empower people in all aspects of their business.

Our people make all the difference in our success. Today, we are a global team of nearly 7,000 and our main objective is to create opportunities for our team members to explore, learn, and grow – all while seeing their ideas come to life and celebrating the differences that make us who we are and the work we do possible.

Principal Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics

As a Principal Data Analyst in Marketing Analytics, you'll analyze marketing campaigns from activity to revenue conversion. You will work with large datasets to develop models and algorithms that provide business solutions. Your expertise in predictive modeling, statistical analysis, and advanced analytics will help optimize campaigns and offer actionable insights. This role involves collaborating with global and regional stakeholders, using data to drive decisions in the fast-paced B2B software industry.

Day-to-Day Responsibilities:


Routinely perform analysis and insight into key metrics and provide recommendations for improving performance in critical campaign areas and throughout the marketing funnel
Lead the deployment and optimization of predictive models to improve omnichannel mix accuracy, campaign completeness, and predict personal behaviors in a complex marketing environment.
Proactively work with all levels of marketing staff to understand and establish goals, determine required data sources and establish marketing benchmarks and metrics
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to execute model deployment and continuously improve model performance
Development and management of reports and dashboards that provide actionable metrics used to optimize and drive marketing decisions
Be the subject matter expert and provide recommendations of best practices related to PTC marketing initiatives
Provide ongoing training to marketing teams on the use of analytics dashboards and reporting tools.
Be an advocate for data-driven everything, evangelize insights on what’s working and what’s not working to help drive incremental gains in pipeline and revenue



Preferred Experience:


Minimum of 3 years in marketing analytics, with at least 1 year in marketing operations
A strong background in marketing, analytics or mathematics



Preferred Skills and Knowledge:


Expertise in tools: Salesforce (SFDC), Eloqua, Qlik, Power BI, Google Analytics (GA4), Google Looker Studio, and BigQuery
Proficiency in SQL, Python, R (or other statistical tools), and experience with data lakes (i.e. Snowflake), ETL tools, and data management platforms
Advanced experience with predictive modeling, statistical analysis, multivariate testing, data standardization, and normalization
Experience with tactical modeling and statistical forecast adjustments to adapt to changing business landscapes
A deep understanding of complex systems and dependencies within marketing operations and the ability to deliver insights that improve overall marketing outcomes.
Strong ability to connect disparate marketing touchpoints and data sources across channels to illustrate the full customer journey and its impact on the bottom line
Strong data evaluation skills with the ability to extract, interpret, and synthesize data from multiple sources, while focusing on actionable, high-level insights.
Capable of leading discussions around marketing initiatives and analysis, with a focus on continuous improvement



At PTC, we believe in the power of diverse ideas and perspectives. As a global company that values and respects all identities, cultures, and perspectives, we strive to create an inclusive PTC for ALL through an environment where everyone feels like they belong and are empowered to bring their true, authentic selves to work. Proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, we welcome applicants from all backgrounds and hire without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, ethnicity, ancestry, marital status, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic identity, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by local, state, or federal laws, rules, or regulations. It is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

Life at PTC is about more than working with today’s most cutting-edge technologies to transform the physical world. It’s about showing up as you are and working alongside some of today’s most talented industry leaders to transform the world around you.

If you share our passion for problem-solving through innovation, you’ll likely become just as passionate about the PTC experience as we are. Are you ready to explore your next career move with us?

We respect the privacy rights of individuals and are committed to handling Personal Information responsibly and in accordance with all applicable privacy and data protection laws. Review our Privacy Policy here."
Show more

Life at PTC is about more than working with today’s most cutting-edge technologies to transform the physical world. It’s about showing up as you are and working alongside some of today’s most talented industry leaders to transform the world around you.

If you share our passion for problem-solving through innovation, you’ll likely become just as passionate about the PTC experience as we are. Are you ready to explore your next career move with us?

We respect the privacy rights of individuals and are committed to handling Personal Information responsibly and in accordance with all applicable privacy and data protection laws. Review our Privacy Policy here."

Title: Healthcare Data SAS Analyst (HEDIS)
Company: Blue Cross Blue Shield of Massachusetts
Description:
Ready to help us transform healthcare? Bring your true colors to blue.

Position Summary

Network Performance Improvement SAS Analysts are responsible for providing data and reporting used to measure quality metrics in support of contracting strategies. This includes the development and maintenance of data and reporting programs used to support provider arrangements, including risk contracts such as the Alternative Quality Contract (AQC) and expansion into other products/providers (PPO, Medicare, Small Group and Hospital).

Key Accountabilities


Provide expertise in electronic clinical data capture and the development of electronic clinical data reporting and analysis.
Development of SAS programs which measure quality metrics used in the measurement & evaluation of providers engaged in incentive programs & other quality based contracts.
Troubleshoot production reporting issues, identify root causes and implement necessary coding updates.
Work with complex health care data to develop and produce standard ad hoc reports and analysis including attribution and clinical data collection and reporting.
Analyzes and investigates Quality data as it relates to HEDIS and other pertinent data to identify areas of improvement.
Assists with research, development, monitoring, and reporting of special projects as requested.
Responsible for developing and documenting project and programming requirements for new and changing quality reporting applications, maintaining proper documentation and back-up for all reporting and data applications.


Qualifications


Proficiency in writing maintainable, supportable, well-documented SAS code.
Strong quality control ethic, ability to assess accuracy of output at report level as well as investigate potential issues at a granular level.
Two plus years of experience programming HEDIS or HEDIS like measures.
Strong focus on data manipulation and ability to drive results to completion with minimal supervision.
Ability to extract, cleanse, integrate medical and pharmacy claims and membership data from various platforms and sources.
Creative problem-solving skills with strong verbal and communication skills.
Excellent customer focus and ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.


Education/Relevant Experience


3+ years' SAS programming experience required.
3+ years’ experience analyzing healthcare claims data.
Prior experience working with medical and pharmacy claims data at either a health plan, provider group or health data vendor preferred.
Development and use of PC applications for data analysis (specifically spreadsheet and database systems (MS Excel, MS Access).
Prior experience working with medical and pharmacy data at either a health plan or provider group or health data vendor.
Strong knowledge of healthcare delivery systems, provider risk and incentive programs. BA/BS required. Master preferred.


Minimum Education Requirements

High school degree or equivalent required unless otherwise noted above

Location

Boston

Time Type

Full time

Salary Range: $76,500.00 - $93,500.00

The job posting range is the lowest to highest salary we in good faith believe we would pay for this role at the time of this posting. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range, and the range may be modified in the future. An employee’s pay position within the salary range will be based on several factors including, but limited to, relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, performance, shift, travel requirements, sales or revenue-based metrics, and business or organizational needs and affordability.

This job is also eligible for variable pay.

We offer comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, medical/dental/vision insurance, 401(k), and a suite of well-being benefits to eligible employees.

Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, or any other form of compensation that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole discretion, consistent with the law.

WHY Blue Cross Blue Shield of MA?

We understand that the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can prevent amazing candidates coming our way, so please don’t hesitate to apply. We’d love to hear from you. You might be just what we need for this role or possibly another one at Blue Cross Blue Shield of MA. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be brilliant. We encourage you to bring us your true colors, , your perspectives, and your experiences. It’s in our differences that we will remain relentless in our pursuit to transform healthcare for ALL.

As an employer, we are committed to investing in your development and providing the necessary resources to enable your success. Learn how we are dedicated to creating an inclusive and rewarding workplace that promotes excellence and provides opportunities for employees to forge their unique career path by visiting our Company Culture page. If this sounds like something you’d like to be a part of, we’d love to hear from you. You can also join our Talent Community to stay “in the know” on all things Blue.

At Blue Cross Blue Shield of Massachusetts, we believe in wellness and that work/life balance is a key part of associate wellbeing. For more information on how we work and support that work/life balance visit our "How We Work" Page.
